review: I haven't been to TGIF in years and its exactly what I remember; over priced, small portions and taste like a tv dinner.

With all the restaurants in the Union Landing mall, you'd think the competition would make restaurants step up.  Not so, apparently. I ordered two meals "to go" (chicken picata pasta).  The person taking the phone order seemed to have better things to do -- and had to ask more than once what I wanted.  She repeated it back, finally, --and hung up.  No reference (like name or phone number), no estimate of when the order would be ready -- just hung up! I immediately got in my car and went to pick up the order.  After being asked to wait when I told her I had called in my order (and she asked what I had ordered), the young woman came back after a while and told me they didn't have it.  Apparently, it was a "new item" on the menu (I had looked at the menu on-line) and they didn't "stock" yet. Come on, people.  First of all, Friday's needs to get their act together.  Second of all, Friday's needs to make sure their people are trained so they know what's on the menu and what's not.  I should have been told on the phone that they didn't have that dish.  But probably MOST important, their people should be trained to act a little more professionally.  Hanging up on customers without so much as a good-bye isn't very hospitable at all -- isn't that what the restaurant business is about? Final result:  I said, "Never mind..." and went and ordered take-out from Applebee's.  At least the server there was pleasant and seemed to know what I was talking about when I ordered!

I used to come here ALL the time.  That is until they decided to turn this one into a bar instead of a restaurant.  Yeah who wants to take their kids out to dinner with a ghetto bar inside the restaurant?  Not me.  Hopefully their bar makes them more business then when it used to be a kid friendly restaurant.

My coworkers and I come here all the time because they have a good happy hour and they are open later than us. The happy hour deals are great, $3 beers, $4 sangrias, and $5 "ultimate drinks", among other deals. The appetizer deals used to be half off, now they're all $6, which, for many of their apps is only a dollar or so off the regular price.  The drinks are ok, and the appetizers are the usual chain restaurant fare: wings, potato skins, mozzarella sticks, etc. Their potstickers are pretty good, but they're a little pricey. Holly always takes great care of us, when we get another server its sort of hit or miss. You kind of get the feeling that they know we work in a restaurant as well, so they know they're gonna get a good tip. Holly, however, is a total sweetheart and has always given us great service. The bar is reeeaaaally packed on most nights, so order a water along with your cocktail, because it WILL take at least 10 minutes to get your drink if you're sitting at a table on a friday night.

Compared with Chili's, their 3 for $20 and 2 for $10 are comparable in value but gives me more versatility. The atmosphere is definitely more active and service a bit better than Chili's. And there was a bit more options here.   Maybe it is a Wednesday but, there were no real crowds and it was very safe without any rowdy bar crowds. To me however, I liked the Chili's steak dinner (2 for $20) than here (3 for $20) because Chili's steak was more tender and the mash potato more flavorful (maybe it was the bacon). However the dessert and service made up for that gap. I believe there eagerness for the grill marks or the way the steak was cut, ruined the steak for me. If you are really picky about the steak, at this price I would recommend Chili's (the nachos and guacamole was also good). However the flexibility and offerings is your thing, then this is a better place for the price. Because of the steak I wanted to give this place 3 stars, but the other aspects earn them an extra star. If the steak was better they might have even gotten the last star due to the price and value.

I was a bit disappointed of the atmosphere of the place, it is kind of old and needs to be upgraded. We missed the happy hour by 10 minutes which was unfortunate.  I saw the advertisement for the berry flavored Guiness but when I tasted it, it did not taste anything like berry.  Fortunately my waitress let me cancel and order something else.  I got the 2 for $10 deal with mozoreellla sticks and pulled pork sandwhich.  the sticks were good and filing. The pulled pork sandwhich ended up being a burger which was disappointng.

I love TGI Fridays. It's always been great service. However last night.. our waitress was sooooo super slow...  Right when we were seated the waitress came back 3 different  times of which, everytime she came she said, I will be right back for ur order.. then our drinks took forever to come out but somehow she was politely rude, if that makes any sense.. lol.. anyhow, we 'll be back in hopes that we won't get the same waitress again!

Typical chain restaurant. There was so many people there and the wait was so long, but the food was only so-so.  My sister and I's favorite appetizer is the fried green beans. Its so unhealthy, but you can't go wrong! The dipping sauce is good too!  The dishes are just normal, chain restaurant food; if you know what I mean. Not bad, but not good either.

The food isnt bad at all. The service is horrible evrytime that I go there. It took forevr to come to our table aftr bein' seated, gettin' our drink orders, gettin' our drinks, takin' orders, then receivin' our meals. I tried comin' on differnt days, but no diffrnces. I personally havnt had the best experiences here as some. I dont recommend, but it is a decent place to eat.

Came here for Happy Hour...the service was great, our waiter is very patient and nice. The only thing I'm disappointed with was my Santa Fe salad, little cubes of chicken and one piece of avocado wow! never again.  The three stars is for the waiter and $3 beer. Yay!
When here with some coworker to get some drinks during happy hour. It was so hard to find a table inside. We decided to sit out and it was freaking. Just after one drink we decided to just go home.

This rating is really for their drinks and happy hour. Love their drinks, the fruity drinks don't have a strong alcohol taste to it and their ultimate drinks for happy hour are made w/top shelf alcohol. If your in the mood for steak, know this isn't a place for great steaks, I order medium rare cus they usually are dry and over cooked. But when you get it don't sit there and complain because what did you expect from this type of place. The food is actually good, if you know what to choose. Think of this place as a fast food place, since the better choices are anything fried and burgers. Every time I come its always for drinks and always at happy hour. When hungry, the usual choices are fried green beans, fried mozorella, fried shrimp, or burgers.

I like this Union City Location because the management take pride and operate it like a local business.  The staff is friendly and I like the happy hour times, because it gives you a decent price for happy hour food and drinks, not some sucker punch where the drinks are cheaper but the foods not.  I was there a bit during the football playoffs and the management decided to extend happy hours to all the 49er playoff games. I sure hope they continue to "bend" the happy hour times to tweak the crowd. I like the fact they have a lot of TVs and parking is not a major problem... I love to tall beers for $3.  Be sure to sign up for the stripes account

Spending an evening with my friend Becca, we were in the mood for munchies 'n movies. We decided on a flick at @ Union City and had about 45 minutes to spare before the movie. Plenty of choices within the parking lot, we didn't feel the time crunch would be an issue. Even if we missed previews....an hour to spare? not bad at all.  This was during the week, not a weekend but still. It was 9ish pm & we first attempted to eat at pasta pomodoro, closed. Sushi place, closed. Fuddruckers, closed. TGI Fridays.... seated immediately.  That's when service took a nose dive. Did not even get greeted by any servers beyond the door person seating us for a good 10 minutes. Next, the server takes our drink orders (easy enough) 2 shirley temples. Ten more min. later he comes back with "Here's your two waters!" My reply- Ugh. Shirley Temples?  Oh yeah (haha, sorry) be right back. The overall order consisted of salad for me with a side of blue cheese crumbles. And an appetizer of pot stickers. In my opinion, easy enough to prepare and bring out. All of this took up nearly an hours worth. Even after bringing the food, the server forgot one LAST item. The silverware, no joke. I was so impatient I had practically eaten most of my salad finger-style before proper utensils arrived.  Very poor service. Not worth the efforts of being open later. We could've found more decent food options at the movie theatre itself.  I rate this chain restaurant with 3 stars because the food/drinks were good despite poor service with a lack of focus and unmotivated staff.

0 stars. Cold dinners, 2 hour mealtime for basic dishes, my 94 yr old grandma said it was the worst dining experience she's ever had in her life. Waitress was mean, manager apologized then left us waiting for 20 more minutes! Utter nightmare and we went hungry! Horribly run Do Not Eat Here you will be sorry.

Menus a dirty sticky mess.  Dirty napkins on the floor under our table along with a rib bone. They were busy so we knew that it would be a wait, no problem.  Food arrived... slighty warm soup, undercooked lobster, the very small potion of ribs were good, the fries and slaw boring.  Went home washed my hands and ate something.  :-P

I agree with some of the other reviewers....  Horrible place.  The 1 star is for the service.  Waitress I had was nice, but not engaging and seemed like she didn't want to be at work.  The food is disgusting.  Instant mashed potatoes, stale meat and over cooked vegetables. Never coming back here again.  One time was once too many.

It's hit or miss with the service here. Sometimes they are prompt and the food is piping hot, or sometimes you wait 30 minutes to see your server. The happy hour use to have a lot of beer options and great food choices, but they have narrowed the choices and now have narrowed the time. I will probably be trying the other neighboring loctions to see what they have to offer during Happy Hour.   The Bartenders are usually pretty nice and work fast but it is not always easy to get a seat at the bar or the bar area.

Went there on April 23,2012.  My son and I sat at a table in  the bar area.  It took 20 minuets for a server to come and another 20 min to get the drinks.  When she dropped off the drink, I ordered another since it would take another 20 min. to get it.  I ordered a steak and mashed potato's.  After the first bite I could taste rotten meat and immediately sent it back.  The waitress was very cavalier.  I asked to speak to the manager and she said he was unavailable.  They took it off the bill and I paid for the only drink that was served and we left.  I would not recommend this place to anyone who doesn't want rotten meat.  Service was very poor and a "don't care" attitude. Shocking and disappointed!

I want to give them a 3.5 stars but since I can't do half star so I am giving them 4. My fiance brought me here because he loves their chicken wings in the Jack Daniel Sauce. We came here on a Sunday right when they open at 11:00am; the hostess looked sleepy when she "welcome" us without a smile; we sat down and was immediate served by a waitress, she was very friendly and helpful.  We ordered an order of chicken wings and an order of steak in J.D. sauce. The chicken was amazingly good! I don't know how they did it but it was very flavorful, crispy on the outside and tender in the inside! I would love to order one more if we had the time to dine longer. Not to mention it was half off; Happy hour on the appetizer menu all day on Sunday! The rib eye steak though, I wasn't too impressed because the beef was not a good quality of beef, it was like something I can get from Denny's but in J.D. sauce.  We also ordered their Bloody Marry with Grey Goose, it was in a huge glass cup that only costed $8; we will definitely coming back here but I will probably only order their chicken wings and some drinks to go along with it.

Call me modern yet, I feel at a family friendly establishment the atmosphere is suppose to make you feel welcome; however to be seated at a table with the hurtful homophobic word F***ot scracthed into it was offensive and unprofessional and after we where seated some where else they seated another party to the same defaced table. It makes no sense for the manager to not have been notified about this when the tables are "suppose to be cleaned after each party. Not to mention the horrible service of our first waitress who had a terrible attitude tall short black haired African American girl named Amber who never advised us our server would be changed. The next waitress I must say was very sweet and attentive, she took care of the situations and troubles she had not caused mind you this was only her third day as she stated I feel horrible I do not remember her name.

This place can be hit-or-miss depending on when you go. Forget getting a table here at happy hour here on a Friday night (10pm to close). Going to happy hour on a Monday night (3 or is it 4pm? to 7pm and 10pm to close) , sure, pick a seat any seat. Sat in the bar area at the high top tables with a friend of mine for happy hour on my recent visit. TGI Friday's has a OK to decent happy hour here with half price appetizers, cheap beer, though I would have rated it a star higher if they actually included all their beers on tap with the happy hour prices (like they once used to), but instead they now only include all the mega brand, no-flavor beers (Bud, Budlight, Miller) - 16 oz beers are $2, 20 oz beers are $3.50 and all bottled beers are $3 - Ultimate Margaritas or Long Island Iced Teas are $5 if you aren't in the mood for beer Our waitress was friendly and helpful and gave us good service and was happy to split the bill for us at the end of the night. Be sure to sign up for their rewards program "Stripes" so you can earn free food and drinks if your a regular here. Speaking of being a regular here, not sure that I will become one since they made their recent decision to not include their "premium" beers in the happy hour prices. At least at the Owl (Hooters) in Fremont, all drinks including mixed drinks at the bar are half price at happy hour.

Let's be honest here, the food is really subpar. That being said, I enjoy coming here after work because it's a great place to just sit down a table with your friends, order some drinks and chat while watching whatever game is on the TV. The green bean fries and Jack Daniels wings are fantastic, and most of the waitresses are friendly and attentive.  The drinks vary in strength in that if you order two rum and cokes, it's entirely possible that one will be super rummy and the other will be mostly coke. If you're looking to get hammered, look elsewhere. That being said, I still like coming because of the appetizers and the drinks, and that's good enough. Manage your expectations -- the entrees are usually very subpar.

This place sucks. Came here with a gift card and bought myself a 2 for $20 dinner including dessert with some friends. The food was okay. The only reason why i'm giving this place a low rating is because our server was a horrible waiter. Our total came out to be $33. We paid with our $25 gift card and $20 in cash.. the problem was that they gave us back 7 dollars back on the gift card. WHY would we get back a gift card with 7 dollars on it? What are we supposed to do with a $7 gift card for a restaurant with bland food??  We complained to the manager and finally got our cash back. Never coming back to this place.

The food is okay.  The buy 1 get 1 makes up for it (1 star up to 3). Service,like what others have stated, is not this place's forte. We got seated promptly since we got there around 5pm, still early and not quite dinner time yet. Our waitress didn't get to our table until literally after 5 minutes later (seemed much longer than that).  By that time, we were ready to order our food, she took them promptly. At this time, there were no utensils/napkins on the table... which we saw all set up on the table across from us. Drinks showed up and so did the appetizer... still no utensils/napkins. Finally our entrees were being delivered... still no utensils/napkins, my wife asked for them.  Now at this point, I thought that our waitress would make getting the utensils her first priority... no stopping at other tables, just really quick get the utensils.  Or grab the ones from the other table for us.  It could have been a really quick fix. After waiting for a short while, she decided to grab 2 sets from the table across from us.  And then the waitress showed up with 2 sets of utensils... a little too late. After that things got better.  I'm guessing she was busy?  But still, what I see here is a lack of time/customer's management. Observing the rest of the crew, I saw many of them walked pass our table without even a slight glance and maybe only 1-2 of them were smiling. I understand that each waiter/waitress has his/her own designated tables, but they all still work for the same restaurant.  A bit better team work would've made things go much smoother.  Maybe help keep an eye out for customers who are ready to order or need something... relay it to the designated waiter/waitress.  Be eyes and ears for each other, instead of everyone for him/herself. Or maybe designate a person or two to do this 'spotting' job, engage the customers. Look and smile to all restaurant's customers, even when they are not on your designated tables.  It might seem so small and simple, but it can add a lot to the overall service impressions and atmosphere. As I stated above, the service did get better toward the end, also the reason why it's a 3-star review. People will always come for great service.  Many would even tolerate the food a bit if the service is great.  Fix the service, I can see this place getting more or updates to 4 stars (at least).

Having read some of the reviews about customer service at TGI Friday's I have to say I am a bit surprised. We had Ottilia as our server and this was one of my, "Food Always Taste Better When You Have A Great Server" moment.  My daughter and I were impressed at how attentive Ottilia was, recommending her favorite soup,  and stopping by our table several times to make sure we had everything we needed. I overheard her getting compliments from the booth next to us so this girl is doing something right . Management, PLEASE acknowledge this employee for having a great attitude and above average customer service!

HORRIBLE! That about sums it up!  If I could give this place a negative, I would!  You must be asking why?  Well here you go.... 1. Service was "holy crap, how is this girl still employed" below standard.  I think everyone in there was right out of high school and didn't know the meaning of  "costumer service." It took forever before our little high school server (with no personality) took our order.  I believe I gave her an order for a cocktail.  Guess what?  Never came!  Was she deaf or stupid? Both? Not quite sure.  Either way, I settled for water.   2. Even though everyone else at the table seemed to like their food, mine...NOT so much.  My broccoli tasted like it was steamed in toilet water.  No joke! Being completely serious here.  It was brown not green.  Why would anyone even put something like that on a plate?  The salmon was good but that was about it.  And thanks for bringing the appetizers out without any plates or utensils.  I'll just eat this wilted salad with my fingers.  Thanks!    3.  The bathroom was disgustingly dirty!  I think someone had a paper towel fight in there.   This place sucks and yup, I won't be going back EVER!  Dang, and now that I think about it, I should have looked at Yelp before going here.  I have learned my lesson.  Anyone who rates this above a one star, you must have seriously lost your mind or have never seen food before and thought this place was the next best thing to white bread.
Went for Happy Hour. Ultimate margaritas 1/2 off. Appetizers 1/2 off.  my appetizer was potato skins... it wasn't flavorful like the ones I've had in the past.

I've never liked coming to this place. Pros: ~ The service is nice. NOT GOOD. Just nice. The servers are very friendly. Crafty people trying to make me feel bad about giving one star but I'm going to do it anyway. ~ Clean.  ~ They have good taste in music. One time I came here and they had The White Stripes playing. Awwww yeah. That's about it. Several things I have to complain about: SLOW. SLOW SLOW. I came here with my family the last time and I wasn't very hungry so I just ordered a side of mashed potatoes. Just a little side of it. Tell me why it took 25 minutes to arrive. Slowest service I have EVER experienced. 25 minutes would be fine for a big plate, but a small cup of mashed potatoes? It wasn't even that good either... Very microwaved, powdery, and tasteless. I tried to make up for it by ordering a red velvet cake.  ... How can you mess up red velvet cake? Why did it taste like dark chocolate and not red velvet light delicious spongey? Why am I eating in your shitty establishment? So many questions.  I'm sorry, the servers are awesome. But TGIF, how many damn chefs do you have?

Walked in and wasn't even properly greeted. I just stood there awkwardly while the 2 hostess girls and one hostess (hoster?) dude talked and ignored me. Like what the fuck man I'm not that short. So I had to ask the guy cause we made eye contact how long the wait was. Then one of the girls answered me and said 10-15 min so I said okay cool and then they went back to talking to each other so I had to ask him if I'm supposed to wait or stand in line (it's been like 5 years since I've been to TGIF) and he said I had to write my name down. And then he just fucking stood there. So I told him to put 2 under my name and THEN he went and got the damn clipboard and put my name down. So after waiting for about 20 minutes we were finally seated.  Our server was nice and quick. Not very attentive cause it was so busy but what can you expect from a TGIF, right? Needless to say after we ate we got the fuck out of there asap. But yeah, the hostesses should be the main people to set the mood in the beginning and these hostesses did a horrible job. Singing and fooling around on the job while ignoring customers. It was really annoying. If I had more time I probably would have complained to the manager.  Most likely will not ever come back.

Been to TGIF several times for lunch and dinner with friends and families.    This place use to be so much better in terms of customer service and food quality.  Well overtime management changes, and so do the staff but that didn't stop me from coming back.  It's close to home, and what more would I want than to have dinner and go watch a movie at the theater which is at a walking distance.  The Jack Daniels chicken strips, french fries with cheese, sizzling chicken and shrimp are my favorite at this place.  They do have meal coupons and happy hour  so if you ever stop by you should check out the happy hour menu as well.  They have a bar area on the right side as you enter.  It has open seating with little outdoor patio.  I hardly see people seated outside as the weather can be unpleasant.  If you want a quiet and romantic dinner, you should find some place else, It can get a little noisy at this place.  They have TV monitors and  during the games people come to have drinks and watch TV at the bar.   Note:  They are open late on Friday's and Saturdays.

Came here on a Saturday night and the experience is horrible. Service was terrible. I understand that the restaurant was packed, but after being seated, the waitress/waiter did not approach our table for a good 15-20 minutes or so. They got our drinks, and left us there. We were sitting at the table waiting for someone to take our order, no one bothered to stop by. We kept waiting. Finally someone came and took our order, appetizers came out within 10 minutes, after we finished, no one came and cleared the table. Entrees took over 30 minutes to come out. Once the entrees came out, my colleague had requested sweet potato fries instead of french fries, they gave her french fries. After being able to get the attention of the waiter, he brought out a dinky plate of sweet potato fries. Really now? The portion of the sweet potatoes was half of the portion of the french fries. Such a disappointment. The tables near us had the same experience. The waitress/waiters were not constant, we had other waitresses and waiters from other sections of the place to serve us. By the time we left the restaurant, we spent a good an hour and a half in there.  Disappointment. Will not be going here again.

Food is ok, service is ok. Place gets packed during happy hour and weekends. It can get loud and noisy. But their brownie obsession is divine! It's warm and topped with chocolate fudge and ice cream,. Delish.

I love this place for a quick dinner... quick and cheap.. seriously, this place has the best 2 for 20 special around the UC area, also for a few more bucks you can pick from the more hearty options, always a plus in my book. They make some pretty good sweet potato fries that you can get as a side with just about any meal :) no extra charge like at other places. Friendly staff, great happy hour menu, good drinks that won't brake the bank, I like this place. Oh and it is never super full, except maybe on Friday nights but at that time you should be home sleeping :)

Outdoor patio which is perfect for my debacherous crazy friends when we're having happy hour. I like the service - as getting drinks is really easy, except on extremely rushed times - even then the bartenders do a really good job of making sure they attend to everyone.  Typical bar food - which is fine with me, don't go expect a 5 course meal though!

I forgot the last time I came here for dinner but just recently I came here for their Happy Hour which was at 10pm til closing for my friend's 21st Birthday. At first it was really packed even on a Tuesday night and we thought we weren't going to get seats but luckily we found two tables that we could put together with a party of about 9 people.  Their Happy Hour selection is pretty good. Drinks are good and fairly priced and food is delicious and pretty cheap. Depending on the time you get there and what day you go on, it is usually packed near the area near the bar because of Happy Hour.  I would say my two favorite drinks on the Happy Hour menu is the Strawberry Margarita and the Mango Margarita. Both are fruity drinks and don't have much alcohol in them. They usually serve them with fruits as well. The food that I always get during Happy Hour because it is worth it because it is only $1.50 is the basket of fries. Had their loaded potato skins too and I have to say it wasn't that bad either for the amount they give you and the price of $4.50 because it was half off. I also have to say that the Jack Daniels sauce is the bomb! I will come back to this place for Happy Hour again and try more of their drinks and food! Cheap and good! NOTE: Happy Hour is 3-7pm and 10-close :)

TGI Fridays is great!  I took my honey here for his birthday and we had a great time. Our waitress was super nice. We ate pasta and we had a great seat by the TV just in case he wanted to glance at the football game that was on. We ate, had drinks, and then our waitress and the other employees came and sang happy birthday to him and gave him ice cream.  Afterwards, I gave him his gift (which was some new Nike's) and he unwrapped them at the table. It was such a great birthday for him! we had a great time here!!
This is obviously a "let's get drunk for cheap" place! It's always ridiculously packed and usually with people you don't want to see.  Not a place you'd go out of your way to go...obvi.

If you read one review of TGI Friday's, you've read them all.  I came here to watch game 7 of the NLCS and this place was wild. Everyone was cheering and it was the perfect environment to watch the game. The female bartenders were pretty quiet and timid but the guy bartender who came right at game time was awesome. He was hyping up the bar and was super nice.  There was however one sleazy guy cracking really vulgar jokes and was annoying me. It was weird that the staff knew who he was and encouraged him! I wouldn't keep pumping him up since it didn't look like he was ordering a whole bunch of stuff and just annoying customers (or me at least). Anyways, this location is pretty nice with lots of televisions and the food was decent.  P.S. that Jack Danial's sauce is addicting. Its the only reason I go to TGI Fridays.

Still a good place to bring family and friends. Love the decor which can have a relaxing affect which is a good thing specailly during the mid-day.Service was great for drinks I had a rum and coke and the wife had the peach sangria. I must say the my drink was perfect youd be surprised how many bartenders there are that can't make a basic mainstay drink. This was on the money! The wife had cajun shrimp with chicken pasta, was delish! Daughter had ribs with shrimp. The ribs very very tasty,my daughter didn't offer me a shrimp. I had the ribeye steak medium with shrimp scampi. The shrimp were prawn size and flavourful, the ribeye was tasty but a tad on the chewy side.The wait staff , what can I say they were there for us!

This place is better than the nearby Applebees, but it still was not that great. It was pretty expensive for what you got,  and also the music is soooo loud that you have to shout at your friends so they can hear you, that made it unconfortable dining there. Overall, this place is Ok, even though our server was nice, I would probably not return.

Gave this two stars because it wasn't that horrible. It was a rainy day in union city, and the boyfriend chose to eat at TGIFridays. We ate here once before. Once we walked through the door , there was no hostess to greet us and I think I said "table for 2" to a person who didnt even work there. Come to find out the hostess was sitting her ass on the customer  waiting benches. Gave her a dirty look, like are you serious, this is your job. She was kind enough to recognize that and freely changed her direction to the booth section instead of the regular tables. I can't complain about our waitress, she was cute and on top of her shit.  The restaurant itself was ehhh..and the bathroom was gross. Didnt even want to sit my ass on that seat. So disgusting.

We attended TGI Friday's last night for a birthday party and we got food poisoning from the cheeseburger that we ate off the same burger and we were both vomiting all day today I would never recommend going there again

Food is decent and price is alright especially during happy hour. What I knocked 3 stars for was that I had to wait literally 45 long minutes AFTER being sat for the server to ask me if I would like to get started with a drink. After I ordered the food it took 45 minutes to get my food, which wouldn't have been so bad if I didn't already wait 45 minutes. I can also be more understanding if the restaurant was packed. This wasn't the case. It was nearly empty during happy hour (they have happy hour for a reason, to encourage more customers to come at late afternoon hours since it usually is slow). The problem was that they only had 1 server for possibly 8 tables or more. Shockingly understaffed. Also, this isn't the first time I've had terribly slow service. This happened at least 3 times already.
This TGIF is close to everything.  Love the location.  Love their happy hour.  Love their Deep Fried Green beans.

The place should be Thank. God. It's. Cold Inside. Why does a place like this has to be so cold during the winter time. It just don't make any sense. I feel for the person who waited on us.  But the food is so overrated here. Granted a lot of chain restaurants use pre-cooked foods.  My baked potato should have been hot not luke warm. Even though I ordered steak on the mid-rare. It came out to be rare and chewy. It was not the right cut for a rib eye. I'm a steak professional. I know my steaks. They need to do their veggies better. Instead of steaming them. They should saute it with olive oil and garlic. Then maybe people will eat more healthier it if was done like that. My mom's dish was overcooked. Her steak was too dry hard to chew. Her lobster tail was way over cooked by a couple of minutes. It looked like a goofball not a lobster tail.  The air in the place made my food cold. A lot of customers still had their jackets on. I was not comfortable in that place because of it.  This place still needs to be improved so does their food. I don't mind the service at all.
service really really slow.....not good in an area surrounded by restaurants

typical fast-food-sit-down joint with a bunch of teens running the place.   nothing stands out. nothing worth complaining about.   had the jack daniels sampler and korean tacos.  not enough meat. it was more like a veggie taco.  it was made with lettuce, and minimal cabbage.  MY BAD.  i wasn't at a korean place...  i will say this: i LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the jack daniels coconut shrimp. it may be worth the slow service ... maybe.

Avoid this place unless its the last place left on earth!! Been going to this place for more than 10 years and were decently satisfied with employees and food/drinks quality. However, we were turned into scapegoats thru conspiracy by the security guard and hostess' on our last visit. All seemed to be fine on this last night that we were there, the bar was closing around 2am, we were asked to close our tab, which we did and paid with a debit card. Meaning that funds had to be available for the damn thing to even go thru. FYI - about 15 mins before we paid and left, a group of patrons (also a party of 4) was asked to leave the restaurant as they were arguing and being rowdy in the restaurant. The security guard quickly escorted them out and let them go. Tons of people saw them leaving. 2 mins after we exited the parking lot of TGI's, Union City police stopped us for not paying our bill. We're like: "is this a joke?", but apparently it wasn't, the security guard and maybe other staff gave the cops our license plate number as the guilty party, when clearly everyone saw the other group of 4 create a ruckus and leave. We explained to the police exactly what happened, but management was unable to clarify this for almost 1 - 1.5 hours, we got home @ 4am that morning. How hard is it for cops to call a restaurant and ask the manager to go thru the last 5 - 10 merchant copies of signed receipts and clear up the matter. My inclination: the security guard was trying to make sure his friends could get as far away as possible while cops could harass an innocent party. SO, just in case your planning to be disrupted by rowdy crowds, harassed by cops and be conspired on by security guards employed here, feel free ! Otherwise, there's tons, literally tons of places, 100 times better in food quality and options and much more decent client base in the area.....

where better to celebrate jesus birthday than TGIs?... and u call yourself.. *humph nah jus joke.. pounded couple cups of jonny walker at the hotel before heading over to TGI to get a head start on my buzz all 3 nights to watch Lakers toy wit GS and Seattle demolish the 49ers. had to say for a family environment restaurant, was getting loud in there for the sad face bay area fans. food was good and everybody was in good spirits, no sissy boys trying to start shet, and plenty oppertunties to holler at the hollerable... had the lobster tails drowned in butter and steak w/ lobster sauce. was very filling. i like the vegis and would reccommend opting for the sweet potato fries, and avoiding the cheesy. they offer a full bar with couple pages of mixed drinks, and wines, but mostly had beer. wait staff was able to customize my order. was a pleasant evening. applebees only stay right there but wasn't as crowded. TGIs was worth the wait.

I like TGI Fridays food.. not the best, but it isn't the worst either.  But that's not the reason for this review.  If you ever decide to own a restaurant and you want to see how a waiter/waitress gives bad service or underperforms, this is the place to go.  This isn't just one occurrence either.  Whether it be missing my meal, a fork that I was asking for 20 minutes ago, burning my chicken and saying that's "normal", waiters waiting on the bar customers more than your booth, never having your drinks refilled unless asked, etc.  This place is not the place to go.  And it's only this TGI Fridays I have issues with.

Totally recommend this place for Happy Hour if you love being ignored! - 40 minute wait for 2 iced drinks. Watered down and LUKEWARM. - Greasy, rubbery, food. With a pissed off face as the cherry on top. But I get it.  Not much to do in this area, and everyone gets thirsty eventually. But you DON'T even get what you paid for here. Invest the few extra bucks and avoid this place unless you want to start off your weekend with a bad taste in your mouth!

The service and food isn't the best but its always cool to hang out at the bar on Friday and Saturday nights. Its pretty chill and there is security that is a little up tight but that's not a bad thing. There is usually a few pretty girls there which is always a good thing. If your planing to get a table the service does take forever so I suggest you only go there to drink and if you want to eat go somewhere else.
Rude servers and hosts. Food is ok, best thing is drinks.

This Fridays has been remodeled recently, at least the bar area has been and it looks pretty good. I usually don't come here to eat lunch or dinner, me and my friends usually just hit the happy hour on weekends when we want to stay local. Can't beat half priced appetizers and cheap drinks. When it gets warmer they also serve outside in the patio area which is nice.

The day before Valentines, I took my wife out to dinner, since 2/14 is always crowded wherever you go.  But on this day, Friday's wasn't that busy, so we were seated right away.   We started with the Crab Cake appetizer, which came out very quickly.  The two cakes were very large and mostly crab with very little filler.  They didn't have much of a taste on their own, but the dipping sauce provided a must-needed kicked. Both my wife & I ordered a steak and shrimp meal, though with different sides.  My wife got the Jack Daniels Sirloin and fried shrimp with a side of Parmesan Garlic Fries and a Tomato Mozzarella Salad.  Her steak and shrimp tasted fine, but the fries were drenched in a really heavy sauce, and she barely touched it.  I ordered a Rib-eye steak and added some scampi shrimp, along with a baked potato and the salad.  I ordered my steak medium rare, but it came out of the kitchen very rare.  It tasted fine, but was a lot more chewier than I prefer.  Next time, I'll order my steak medium to get the right texture. Overall, the meal was just fine.  Not bad, but not fantastic, either.  Our service was exceptional, though, with our server refilling our drinks frequently.
They have happy hour on drinks & appetizers. It's a long wait, but dining here is worth it if your w/ friends and/or family & if your in the area.

We thought we'd try Friday's since we hadn't been to one in years.  Now i know why....this place sucks. Extremely slow service. ..waited 40 minutes for our order. During the wait our waiter never came to check on us or update us on our status. Only after asking another waiter what's up did he come over and say it would be another 5 minutes. He looked like he had been eating while we were here hungry because his teeth were filled with food. And the restaurant wasn't even very busy.  After 20 years in the business myself i can be patient if they are busy but the weren't.  When  we finally got our food it was hot but nothing special.  Silly me for attempting to eat here. Don't recommend this plac e unless you want a loud place with slow service and okay happy hour  prices.

My husband and I just got back from dinner here. It was Sunday night happy hour and extremely packed, it took a long time to be served out meal and my husband's Fire Grill Chicken didn't come out looking like he expected at all, he thought the picture looked like rice with broccoli mixed in, but when his plate came out with a huge serving of broccoli I thought he was going to send it back. He decided the chicken and the rice looked fine and he started eating it instead. I ordered the Jack Daniels Rib-eye and lobster tail, it was really great! I would have given it a 4 stars minimum for my meal, but my husband was annoyed with the really long wait times and his meal.

If your vegetarian, there is limited selection.  There's hardly any vegetarian entrees. Only a couple of items from the appetizers can be made vegetarian. I've tried the spinach dip, loaded potato skins  (comes with bacon on it and I had to remove it myself) . Both are decent.  TGI Fridays- its time you get your act together and come to the 21st century by putting vegetarian offerings on your menu! On a positive note, TGIF is a cool spot to meet up with friends. I do like the atmosphere but unfortunately, the atmosphere I cannot eat. I won't be back anytime soon.

I feel like every time I come here I'm gambling.  I really like some of their food but I hate how inconsistent it is.  Example, my fiancé and I ordered the cajan chicken and shrimp pasta, which is really good (typically), but it seems like every other time we go in there it's a different recipe or something.  One time it tasted AWFUL and all the waitress said when we brought it to her attention was "oh".  The next time we went in it was great!  I don't get it.
The food and service was ok. But I didn't liked to have mold in the glass of water I've ordered though. Not professional, and kinda not really healthy too. :(

I usually come to Fridays after work and order appetizers. Service is ok the staff is friendly but last time I came two of them were arguing about some personal stuff. It was unprofessional and kind of annoying trying to get their attention. Jack Daniel chicken strips is a hit for me. Cheeseburger sliders not so much. Made me sick twice. Always check for happy hour. Appetizers are half off. Don't order the steak its obviously not a steakhouse... It's dry and has no flavor. Bad experience with the entrees. Perfect place for cocktails and appetizers

I wish we had checked the yelp review first. We waited half a hour on a friday night to be seated... which is to be expected. Then we sit down and order our drinks and appetizer. Our appetizer comes before our drinks. We have no water no drinks. Then our drinks come. Mind you we waited for our appetizer for ten minutes. Then we order our food food and I order the half rack of ribs and two sides like maria said. Also I forgot I ordered coffee at the very beginning of this. No coffee yet. I get my food and I have one side. So I ask maria and she says oh there is only one side. I look at her like... wtf... so in a bit she brings me the other side of mine and says.. I shit you not she says "well next time know that this dish comes with one side".... really arent you supposed to know... not me... Then she comes and asks if we want any more to drink and i ask for my coffee again.  Finally we ask for our bill. The bill comes and I steal it from my friend who thinks he is going to pay... I look at the bill and my coffee isn't there. Good one good thing out of the night she is going to give me free coffee for her crappy service. The bill is $57 and some change. I give her my card and away goes my bill. It comes back for me to sign and it say $60 and some change... HUH?? I look, there is my coffee on there. Well that's it, here's my tip $1 (which i have never ever done, i tip 15-20% because I know how hard servers work) and I write Thanks for the slow service. I walk out and my friend goes and talks to the manager. Well, the manager, Teressa was a really pleasant lady to speak to he said.  She was really apologetic. If it wasn't for her I would have given it a one star. I will go to the Valco TGI Friday's and never to the Union City one again.

Our server really did a lousy job. We were really close to having the manager come to our table, before we paid our bill. I really wanted to argue with the $1 tip my friend left, but i couldn't. I did have a talk with the manager before leaving, to explain our dissatisfaction. She was understanding and apologetic and really wanted to make it up to us. As a server, Maria did a lousy job of representing the business... as a manager, Teresa did a good job of trying to salvage the situation. I'll probably give them a chance to get a better rating from me.

Thought we'd get there early and celebrate my kids' bdays. Got there around 4:30 and the place was clearly not busy at all. No one in the front to greet and  take you to your seats. Took about 3-5 minutes. Got seated and I discreetly asked if they do something special for bdays and told her that we're celebrating two. She smiled and said she'll take care of it. There were only four of us so it wasn't like we're keeping her busy. Got the drinks and appetizer just fine. Took a little longer for the entrees. Food was just okay...nothing special. But the service was clearly lacking when you can't even get drink/water refills. Server came around once, probably after we'd each taken a bite or two to check on us. That was the last time. We sat around a long time after we'd all finished our meals, when someone else (not our server) asked about dessert. I guess our server totally forgot about the bday celebrants. I asked for a couple of minutes to peruse the dessert menu. Kids picked out what they wanted, then our original server came around 15 minutes later. We ordered dessert (still didn't jog her memory and I didn't bother mentioning it 'coz it would take away the element of surprise) & asked for water refills. Before she could move too far away, she asked a colleague if she could get us water. The other's reply was "I've got people in the front" & turned her back. 30 minutes later, we finally got our dessert--a couple of ice cream-filled oreos served on a plate with choc/caramel drizzle. 30 minutes!!! At this point I got up to take a look around. Sure...other patrons but definitely not crowded, especially when you see 4-5 servers standing around in the soda station chatting...but no one could be bothered to give us water refills!  We picked this place 'coz the kids said that out of all the places in Union Landing, we haven't gone back to this one in a while-- at least a couple of years. Now we all remember why. We always get spoiled @ Chili's & Chevy's with the fast service, so I think we'll be staying away from Friday's for at least another couple of years.

Lately their service has been pretty bad. The last 2 times I've been here, they've messed up my orders. Today, it took them over 10 minutes to come over and ask me about what I wanted to drink. They didn't have the wine I wanted (Robert Mondavi Private Selection), they screwed up my drink and the way things are going, I'm sure they will also mess up my order. This place used to be a nice place with geat service, but quality of service has significantly gone down.  At least the new booths and chairs make the place look better.

I LOVE this place. Awesome Happy Hour and awesome staff. I usually sit at the bar area and enjoy a game. Last night they had a bartender competition and it was AMAZING. I thought I was in Vegas for a second there. Next time you are in, ask when the next bartender comp is going down. You will be  entertained for free! A+ service on price and location. Cons-Finding a parking spot and a seat can be a challenge but it's worth the wait.

Ate here this weekend, and it was the most disappointing meal I've ever had. We waited 40 minutes for nachos. When they arrived, they were cold, and the jalapenos were NOT on the side, like we had requested. 30 seconds later all of our food arrived. My husband got the wrong side, and his ribs were only warm. My crunchy parm crusted chicken had sat under the heat lamp and was neither crunchy nor hot. Room temp is being kind. The sauce on the side of tortellini was all glazed over, like it had been sitting for too long, and the tortellini was borderline cold. My daughter's mac and cheese was only just warm, and the broccoli was cold.  With an antsy one and two year old, who had been waiting for food for 40 minutes at this point, we opted to just eat it, but I complained. The server was apologetic, as was the manager, and he removed the nachos and ribs from the bill. That was nice of him, but still.... it was a waaaay disappointing meal. I was a waitress for many years, and I know "stuff" happens, but our server and food was was terrible. We will not be coming back.

Came in here for brunch with 2 friends. I hdnt seen them in awhile and chose this place since I've never eaten at it. It was pretty empty but is was 11AM. We weren't expecting it to be busy. It was pretty clean. No messy tables. Our waitress was pleasant. It took us about an hour to order. We hadn''t spoken to each other for so long that we were catching up and had no time to look at the menu. Our waitress was kind enough to wait and she frequently checked on us to see if we were ready. I ordered the korean wraps, my friend got the salmon and my other friend got the fettuccine. We all had some mozzarella sticks for the appetizer. They were good but i wish they offered more sauce. korean wraps were BOMB!!! I'd order them again. It doesn't come with hot sauce and I had requested some. She said they only had tabasco and wing sauce. she said the wingsauce was pretty hot and I told her I don't mind as long as its okay for me to have some. she brought both of them and i ended up just using the wing sauce. it sure was hot and i only used it sparingly. but it didn't add that kick it needed. if you like spicy i recommend you requesting the sauce its so good!!! i was very happy that the accommodated to my needs. the beef was cooked well it wasn't tough. it came iwth a side of rice and had some cilantro in it. i was kinda confused about it since it was on the side. i guess you can add some in your wrap or eat it on the side. i did both. and it both worked. Its a pretty healthy meal. not friend or drenched in cheese. i was very content with the portion too. DEFINITELY WILL ORDER AGAIN. I had a bit of my friends salmon and shrimp. It was pretty watery. The fettuccine was alright. For the most part my friends didn't finish their food. They thought theirs was okay.

Place is okay. Always clean. Food quality was better at one time. Now it is of cheap quality. Example the "Jack Daniels burger". Burger size has shrunk and is not as tasty. My favorite waiter is Angel. He already knows who we are and knows what beverages we like. Worst waitress (without mentioning any names) is L. One time I paid with a gift card and went 15 cents over. She had the nerve to ask for the .15 cents. A good waitress would of taken care of it and since we were regular customers. I was expecting that she would of taken care of it. Anyway the laugh is on L. Every time I go there I always request Angel.

I come in for drinks sometimes. Try the Roscato (red moscato) and the sangrias. The staff is friendly and quick and it's other patrons mind their own conversations even while they're next to you at the bar.

Man, TGIFridays are becoming a dying breed, good thing they have a store near a guy I am dating in Union City. Anyway I remember why I fell in love with them all those years ago plus I've fallen in love with a new item too. The following summarizes my latest adventure here: PLUSES: Great vibe Cool new decor (dark woods and adult fixtures) Delicious food (Sizzling chicken and cheese, ALWAYS a favorite) Friendly staff My date likes so much he keeps talking about it MINUSES: Ummmmmmm Uhhhhhhhhhhh Hmmmmmmm ORGASMIC: Whiskey Cake (the word favorite is so understated!) See you next week perhaps?

Came in here for lunch with a friend after church to watch an nba playoff game. We normally go to BJs but decided to give Fridays a chance. There was a crew of employees that gathered at the table in front of ours, not sure if they were on shift yet, but they talked about everything that happened during the week and cussed like there was no tomorrow. They were so loud. Needless to say it didn't make the experience very memorable, but the food was good and there were lots of people watching the game so the atmosphere was manageable. We had a couple of orders of buffalo wings and the jack sampler. Not sure if this is the place for family if this is how the staff behaves normally. May try it again, but during a different time when there is a different staff on call.

I understand some employees have off days... But when u come to work leave all the drama outside the door.First they want us to stand for 15mins while there's a table available right in front of  us.Then we order drinks and they tasted like water downed kool aid. Instead of offering us a different drink this mF just takes um off the table n don't say nothing. Smh wtf is that. We're paying customers.we ain't trying get nothing for FREE.Do not go here.This place is Officially  INVALID!!!!!!!!

The waitress told me "sure you can use the coupon but you can not use it to order anything with lobster on the entree menu." I asked why we couldn't use it for lobster and the waitress told me their manager told them that but she can ask her manager see if they allow us to use it this time. After a minute, she came back after asking the manager and told us her manager said we can use it for THIS TIME ONLY .. (OK.. good)  We ordered  Appetizer: BBQ chicken flat bread $10 Entree: lobster & ribeye entree $24 Entree: lobster & ribs entree $22 Off the entree menu: we ordered a burger  $12 Drink: Gold Medalist $3.5 Drink: Another fruit drink $3.5 After placed the order the waitress told us they can only free the Burger because it free the cheapest entree out. I told her the burger isn't even from the entree menu, are you kidding me? I re-read the coupon to her that says buy 1 entree and get 1 free with 2 beverages equal or less value.  My dad got angry and asked what if we need to split the check will we get the second lobster entree free then? The waitress said yes if we don't mind doing it and she will ask her manager if that is OK. After a minute she came back and said she got it taken care of. THANK YOU FOR MAKING US FEEL EMBARRASSED The food was excellent but really the experience trying to use your coupon is a joke. I don't think I will be coming back in a while.

i came here with my coworkers meeting up with a vendor for a lunch meeting. it was pretty empty on a wednesday afternoon. we were seated immediately. our waitress took our drinks order but was bad at refilling our cups. it was here's your drinks and never really checked if we needed refills. bad bad. i ordered the korean tacos -- i don't know why would i order korean tacos at an American chain restaurant... but the picture in the menu looked delicious. When our food came it was looked delicious, but when i took a bite.. the beef was super dry. flavor wasn't consistent. i took a bite of the rice -- omg.. it looked moist but it was SUPER DRY! YUCK overall, the service wasn't great. no refills, didn't make sure everyone had utensil, we weren't checked up upon.  come back? eh i'll rethink about it.

One word. AWFUL. Awful food, Awful Service. I came here on Friday with a few friends to enjoy a dinner out. By the end of the meal, the service was so horrible and we were so hungry, we were almost not even friends anymore lol. When we arrived, we put our name down on the waitlist. I stood outside the front doors for us to get called. About 15 minutes later, I walked in again to check on our table, the host gave me mad attitude and told me he had already called our table and next time I should stand closer to the restaurant. Excuse me? I was right outside the front door, maybe you should use your legs and go check. Wtf? I actually mentioned out loud that I had been right outside, and he gave me a death stare. Then he proceeds to seat us at the back most table next to the bathrooms and the kitchen. Again, WTF? Next, our waiter was "on a break" so we got another waitress taking our order. Our waiter was not at all apologetic, and he barely came by to check on us. He pretty much ignored us everytime he went to the kitchen... hmm maybe it had something to do with the crappy seating. Overall, I am not cool with this place. I don't like spending my money on a useless meal with terrible service. I could cook better food and be happy eating in. This place is a terrible chain, and for the price of their food, I expect some better service. Needless to say, I will never be going back here again. And a note to the host with a terrible attitude, you suck at your day job.

Called to order something to go. Had me stay on hold for the length of two songs only to tell me that the items featured on the FRONT of their official site was not available. Not because they ran out, but because they just don't offer it.

Every time I have been to this Fridays I have had terrible customer service. The waiters and waitresses never seem to check in on you or anything. A few friends and I had gone on a Sunday for their happy hour, which is one plus they offer on Sundays. All day happy hour with half off appetizers and fairly priced certain drinks. My friend ordered a plate of fries, when they came out they were cold and stale! We had to flag down another waitress and she replaced them. We all got various appetizers from the boneless wings to the nachos. It took forever for our food to come out, and when it did they too were cold and stale. The wings were hard and not fresh and the cheese on the nachos looked like it had been sitting there for a while. Definitely only coming back for happy hour drinks if that.

The bar tender mike is really nice and friendly. We bought drinks from him all night because he had great customer service and always had a smile on his face. As of the other workers they looked miserable. I definitely would come back to the bar at least

Came on a Friday to meet up with friends and celebrate. We went directly into the bar area and into a booth that was empty. Bar area = open seating .. right? WRONG. So tell me why we were seated for a good 15-20 minutes, servers and busboys passing by our booth taking glances, yet no one ever acknowledged us. The manager of this place really should look into whether or not these kids they're hiring for a customer service oriented position knows ANYTHING about customer service. The apathy we witnessed was really pitiful.

Everything we order here was so damn good. I had a rib eye steak cooked medium with grilled shrimp, mashed potatoes and some fresh vegetables. Even though I could not finish all of my meal,  it was delish. I also had some wings and a wedge salad with blue cheese dressing, loved it!!  Plus the service was great!!
Don't go here. Go to the Texas Roadhouse, see Mario and Ozzy. At least they have common server manners.
Happy hour 3-7

terrible!!!  came to have some good laughs, talks, food, and drinks with some folks (4 of us) on 8/10. the waitress we had in the bar area ashley fullbright (yes ill put yo scamming ass on blast) so we had about 30 mins to happy hour and she was ok until she came back the second time. felt like she pushed us to order. as 10pm came around we ordered exactly a three for all, 4 margaritas, 1 electric blue lemonade, 1 raspberry tea, 2 burgers, and buffalo wings. chips and dip are free if you have a fridays card (which we had). so as we get our drinks, food, etc... ms. ashley never served us (wasn't even busy) she comes back once asks us if there was anything else we wanted we said yea more water, and a raspberry tea refill...she never comes back with water or the refills, but was sure to bring the bill. Bill came out to be 78.68 not excluding the chips and dip. i asked her to take it off since i did have a card...she comes back and gives me change for it. so we pay with 62.00 cash and i put the rest on my card which was 16.86. the bizzie puts 26.86 on my card which wasn't right so i tear the store copy receipt and told her to bring a new one thats right...she never did. so we leave. i then look at my acct sunday morning and she charged the whole damn bill to my card and took the 62.00 as her time. first off you weren't deserving of any tip, second thats your job don't like it get another!!! i go back and a manager by victor tries to help me by saying that my card was only charged for 26.86 told his thats not what is on my banks end, told em i want a copy of the card swipe, and new receipt since she should of gave me one! i get the info take it to my back just in case and now just waiting...if you go there make sure you dont have ashley as your waitress!!! will i go back...depending

This place needs to have a chat with their staff...I ate here a few days a go with my husband and we were seated right away, but after the waiter came by to take our order things went down hill from there. We ordered the BBQ chicken pita bread something fairly simple and should be quick to make, it came out later than expected, but it was ok since sometimes food comes out a little late.  Our dinner however one being steak that was medium rare which was more like medium and very chewy and a burger that came out very dry all came way later than the appetizer! Forty minutes is way too long for what we ordered, that and never asked to refill our water, we had to wave them down.  I remind you this place was in no way busy! Next time going to go to Texas roadhouse instead...

I met up with an old friend here last night an it was my first time at TGI Friday's. The service was prompt and efficient--our waitress was so nice and made sure our drinks were always filled. We ended up ordering two appetizers and one entree and a dessert and splitting all of that; needless to say, we were stuffed by the time we stumbled out of the restaurant. It's your typical American chain restaurant--dark, loud, noisy, and mediocre food but something about this place charms me. You HAVE to try their potato skins. So good!

Where do  begin ???  Poor service , waitress walked by at least 4 times before we were acknowledged. Then when our food arrived the waitress handed me my HOT plate without warning.  Her reply " im use to it as I did'nt notice cuz I just handled drinks" WTF , I dont work here and I'm not use to hadling hot plate. Thanks for the warning. It will be reflected in your tip.  The food  was just as bad as the service, dry tasteles chicken. Maybe it was overcooked beacuse it came from " Foster Farms"  I wont be coming back any time soon.

was heading into Applebees but their happy hours ended at 6, did a quick Google and TGI's happy hours is until 7, I don't usually go into TGI cause it looks more expensive, but it wasn't. alcohol price is about the same, but the appetizers selection is double of chili's and applesbees. The waitresses were great, Alex and another girl working at the bar, even check up on me twice in 20 minutes. I get more cellphone signals in here, service was great, lighting is excellent, atmosphere is perfect what a bar should be. My sesame chicken did took over 15 minutes which was kinda long for an "appetizer" item, which is the only star deducted. overall very nice experience, will repeat for sure.

Went to happy hour on a Friday in the bar and the server with the head wrap was our server. We ordered a margarita each. An hour later, she came by asking for more drinks. Are you kidding me? She came to our table 2 times within 2 hours. Terrible service, I'll stick to chilis from now on.

Got here a little before 6 pm on a Sunday night. I was driving home to Sac when I got hungry all of a sudden and remember those TGIF commercials. Luckily there was one nearby.  It looked like there was a wait, but we walked in and waited to be seated for about 30 seconds when the manager comes to the front and asks us if we had been helped. I said no and we got seated right away. I asked about happy hour and he said Sunday is happy hour specials all day long! Half off all appetizers except platters and seafood. If I wasn't headed back home I definitely would have ordered a drink. We ordered a basket of fries for $1.50, a bowl of clam chowder, garlic parmesan wings, chicken quesadilla, and nacho grande. Came out to $23! Great deal for tons of food. Our server was friendly and fast. It was really busy, but he kept checking in on us. Will be checking out our TGIF in Elk Grove soon. Hope they got the all day happy hour too. Would have given them 5 stars if their wifi signal worked in the restaurant.
Nachos grande great.

Went here as a nod to my wife's preferences.  Decent service, but probably the worst quality rib eye that I've ever seen.  Just awful food quality.  To top it off, ordered shrimp with the steak and got a nice bout of food poisoning.  First time ever!  Thanks TGIFs!
The bar happy hours ahhhh and great bartenders

I'm still quite baffled by how much quality has gone down over the years at this particular Friday's restaurant. I used to be such a big fan of T.G.I. Friday's, I might even have called it my favorite restaurant. Unfortunately from my past visits, I have slowly watched the quality slowly die.  Last night (Sunday), Friday's was crowded, but it wasn't exceptionally crowded. We were able to be seated within 10-15 minutes vs. the 30-40 min wait we were used to. Which is good. Except -- after we were seated, we had to wait another 15 minute before a waiter came by and introduced himself and asked us if we wanted anything to drink, by then all four of us had already decided what we wanted to eat for dinner. Meanwhile, we watched 4-5 different waiters/waitresses walk past our table serving everyone else food. - 1 5 min later, he brought us our drinks, there was something in my drink. But he noticed it as soon as he put it down on the table, which is good. Except after he brought me a new drink, there was still something inside... -1 Another 10-15 min went by and we all got our orders. Reasonable amount of wait time at a Friday's restaurant, so I figured what the heck, no complaints here. Except my sirloin that I ordered medium well was super well done, dry, and difficult to chew/swallow. My mom's, on the other hand, was ordered well done but her's was juicy and semi-bloody. Either the chef/waiter got it mixed up, or they have consistency issues. Either way, -1. Also my GRILLED shrimp was cold and flavorless, and my sweet potato fries amounted to barely a small handful.  Waiter overall polite enough, not especially friendly or memorable. It really used to be whenever my parents asked where I wanted to go for dinner, I would by default answer "Fridays!" But now, I have several choices, and it's usually not Friday's anymore.  Verdict: Would go, but only rarely.

The services sucks!!! Sat at the bar area for 1/2 hour NO ONe came up too us!!! I had to say something to a server before she can help us!!! She said oh I'm sorry no one told me I had new customers at the table!!! What the heckl it doesn't matter if we're new or old you should be coming around your area to check if we need anything!!! This place sucks!!

I don't know what happend to their service, it was never like this. Just horrible, the waiters ignore you. It takes 20 minutes just to get a drink, I remember when the jack Daniel chicken was so good, it's not the same anymore. They should have no stars. The only reason they got 2 is because 2 things. Mashed potato with jack Daniels sauce and strawberry shortcake with 4 pieces of bread....umm umm umm luv it.
Poor quality of food and poor customer service. Pricing is unreasonable for serving size. Basically paid for frozen-packaged food. I will never suggest anyone to come to this establishment.

WARNING!!!!  DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING ON THE SEATS OR FLOOR OF YOUR CAR.  I was there last night for a quick dinner, car was parked IN FRONT of the floor to ceiling window first set of stalls.  My window was broken and belongings stolen.  TGI could care less, I spoke with manager, they don't have outside cameras, just inside cameras.  Union Landing is getting to be a scary place so be safe.  The food...it was ok, salmon overcooked, service was slow.  I will find a better and safer place to eat.  I say this because this is a nightly occurrence in Union Landing.

Went here last minute with my bf, felt alittle bad because it was so late. But we got seated fast, and the service was awesome! Also the manager was still there that late and took the time to make sure our order was handled good and that we were happy. I haven't had great service like this in a restaurant in some time. So thanks to the TGI Friday's crew and we will be back!!

Personally I find TGI's are over hyped, it's just a sports bar themed restaurant, I do like to come here though simply because of their 2 for $10 menu. Granted there isn't a huge amount of choices within this option but it does include some of their staple dishes such as the spinach sirloin, bruschetta pasta, friday's shrimp, etc... Places like this either leave my wallet burning or my stomach empty so its nice to get a decent meal (appetizer and entree) for just under $13. And if you come for lunch there's rarely a wait at all. Dinner well that's another playing field, If you know you're going to be eating here and you're a group of more than for your best bets to avoid a wait that can go from 30 minutes to even an hour is to make reservations unless you guys are okay with taking over the bar and even than that's hard to do during happy hour.

Went for happy hour with my friends and some co workers the appetizers and drinks were good only thing that kept me from giving them a higher score was the service the waitress were not attentive and were just chatting among themselves not paying that much attention to customers i had to waive my hand multiple times to get there attention and also to pay lol someone didnt get a good tip thats all i have to say.

Our food took awhile to make its way to us. However, our waiter and the rest of the employees were all very friendly and extremely hardworking. A baby at a nearby table knocked over several glasses of water & a bus boy came around to clean it up and couldn't have been more pleasant about it.  I don't fault any of the employees for the amount of time it took us to get our food. Friendliness and hardworking attitudes count for a lot in my book. ;) Clearly, this place needs to hire more people.

Went in October 2013 on a Saturday it was packed but we were seated in 25 minutes.  Myself and husband and 10 year old son.  We sat in a huge wooden booth near the Bar.  The music was old school and jamming and very loud.  I had the rib eye steak it was so good with shrimp.  My husband had the jack Daniels ribs as always he loved his meal.  My son was adventitious he had the kids chicken tenders and he hated them. Our waitress kept the soda's coming and was surprising attentive.  We live in Emeryville, CA but my husband and I can't wait to go back.  We wish it was closer but we will go back again and again.
It's so horrible that I have been waiting 15-25 minutes at a time everytime we order something.  Ive asked for the check for 3 times already within 30 fucking minutes.

Went here with coworkers last night after a long day at the office. We all rushed over, worried they closed at 10pm. Too our surprise they were open...and until midnight! Things kept getting better when we realized happy hour started at 9:30pm M-Th. Our table ordered 2 of the Jack Daniels Tenders (always a GREAT choice,) a Chicken Quesadilla (a little on the soggy side ,) Thai Pork Tacos (good, but didn't look anything like they do in the advertisement...3 VERY small tacos, and not half off on the happy hour menu.) and the BBQ chicken flatbread (on the low cal menu...only 340 calories!!) Our table was drinking LITs and Guinness...drinks were great for the price!! Ended up getting out of there with a $20 tap/pp. Not too bad!! Will certainly return in the future

Food was decent but love their happy hour menu. Haven't been to many restaurants with happy hour on weekends. Love their half off appetizers: Nachos grande was good, baked potato skins lacked cheese, buffalo wings was bomb, and bbq chicken flatbread was okay. Brownie obsession for dessert, omg amazing!! Friendly service and had a a good time with friends.

I love T.G.I. Friday's and that is only based on the fact that I can't really get their Jack Daniel's sauce any other place, plus I love their maison butter. I used to go all the time just to have the petite sirloin with loaded mashed potatoes and fries but their service has been lacking for let's say the past 2-3 years? Busy day or not you will spend quite a while waiting for your server to get to you. Once you get seated sometimes it takes a while for them to even ask you for what kind of drink you want, then they get you drinks and take even longer to come back and get your order. It would be great to have had a server who is always checking up on you and not you having to look around for your server just to get a refill, extra sauce or even just the check. My point is, they need better servers and I'm sure they actually have decent ones but this review is based on the not so great ones.

I only come here on Sundays because of their Special because everyone loves a deal!  My date and I each ordered the Jack Daniels glazed wings and split the Loaded Potato Wedges. Our total bill was 15.00 and we were more than full. I couldn't even finish the all the wings.
I ordered the Brushetta Chicken off of the lunch menu and guess what????? It sucked!!  A Marie Callender frozen entree is way better and cheaper!  I just bought crap for lunch!!  ICK!

50% appetizer happy hour lured me in.... what was I thinking? The food was disgusting and I felt sick the next day. The service was crap. It took forever to order food, drinks, and get the bill. The waiter we had never once checked on us and we had to grab him and ask for more drinks on two occasions. Never again.  TGIY - Thanks God I Yelp!

After a busy morning at the office, I wanted to get out for lunch instead of the usual nuke the frozen meal for lunch at my desk routine. I drove up the road a couple of miles to the TGI Friday's at Union Landing for lunch -- overall, not the best choice. When I arrived, the two girls at the front seemed a little confused but seated me promptly at a booth and presented me with the menu and walked away ... no drink order??  She came back about five minutes later and asked if I wanted something to drink and I ordered an iced tea.  She brought me an "iced" tea -- sans ice and room temperature.  Another 10 minutes passed before my server, Devon, came by to take my order. I mentioned that it had been 10 minutes, and all Devon could seem to manage was an "I appologize" and a weak excuse that he had been taking care of a large party.. I could see his large party.. all of six people!! Hmmm??? I had the Dragonfire Chicken with jasmine rice and broccoli.  The meal came out in about l4 minutes (yes, I timed it).  The meal was just OK, not a lot of flavor but at least the chicken was fully cooked and still moist. I was never asked if I wanted a refill on the "iced" tea as my empty glass sat at the edge of the table for the last half of my meal. Devon eventually came by and asked if I had finished and wanted the check.  Still no offer to refill the drink. The food was OK but the service stank like last week's fish.

It's been years since I ate at TGIF.  I used to like it when it first opened... Maybe it's just this one site now, but my lunch experience was very bland. Lite lunch. I just had the French Onion soup. The broth was like a weak tea with no flavor. Not many onions, and flavorless white cheese made it perfectly forgettable. I almost  sent it back. But my companion had the Caesar Salad which consisted of a small amount of Romaine with some grated (not fresh) cheese and no dressing. The waitress brought a side of bottled Italian dressing when asked and was apologetic that it wasn't pre-dressed.  For the price? and the soup? I would have done better at the IHOP next door.  Next time I will.  It's stale and old. Originally they had some fun things on the menu. Now it felt like a low-end Denny's.

When we first moved to Union City, I was excited to be near Fridays.  Unfortunately, this place has really gone downhill.  The service is just okay, but the food taste like they pulled it out of a can, freezer, bag, or some other sort of cheap grocery store purchase. Service - 3 stars Food - 1.5 stars
Whenever I hit Fridays in Union Landing u have to head to the Bar to a Bartender Name Mike Greatest Bartender in the World Hands down ! In a packed bar he made me feel rite at Home !

So,  I was here for my friends birthday and just hoping to get a good meal because I was starving especially since I just got off work and didnt eat anything.First i want to say is that the service was decent, no complaints here, the servers were polite and took down my order quickly. Other than that the vibe is good, not too loud and not too quiet. The only problem, that I can say is the prices for the food did not match what they gave me. Its like they were stingy on the food or something because I ordered a burger and I thought it would be at least decent size because it was bit on the pricey side. The burger was pretty small compared to the picture and they gave me like a size small fries that looked like it was from Mc Donalds. Honestly, I would have gone to applebees because at least there portions are decent size, enough to actually get me full. I only gave it that extra star because of the service and the setting, other than that the food, is not worth spending money over.

Free wifi in Union Landing! I sometimes need to get work done around here and I don't like the vibe at that little coffee shop downtown, so I was really pleased to find out that this place has wifi. Super nice service. How's the food? Sysco processed junk, but you know that already.

My wife saw an add on TV for an offer of a 2 for 20 dinner, what a run around we got, the hostess seated us and brought us menus, our server came and we told him we'd like the 2 for 20 menus , he brought some funky looking cards that we're small and nowhere near what my wife saw in the T V commercial, when asked about it he said that they were printed on some sort of paper, I told him that the whole thing was a scam just to get us in the door, we left.... Went around the corner to the Texas Roadhouse and enjoyed a great meal without all of the smoke and mirrors this place demonstrated

Not a big fan... The food all tastes the same. Watch a movie like office space and you want to like this place. Center bar, lots of flair, giant menu.  How can you go wrong...
