By making the good all taste the same. I'm assuming the executive chef is the same one from Applebee's who specializes in bland.  After thoroughly dunking all menu items in ranch dressing I found they still taste the same but at least it's masked like a fabreeze shower before a date.

Walked in. A waitress walked past. No eye contact. . Actually looked away. The hostess was absent. After an embarrassingly long time, We waived down some guy that looked like he worked there. He sat us next to a table of kids.  Left. Won't be back.

I don't frequent TGIF but saw a commercial for their new burgers and had to try one. The burger was excellent. I ordered seasoned fries. There's an extra charge for them but they look exactly like regular fries and they tasted like only salt and pepper was added. They're supposed to be bottomless but the waiter charged for them as a separate item.  I have to say that service was lacking all around. The entrance is odd in that there isn't room to check in and step aside so everyone stands around and it's just a cluster.... no one is ever at the front when I arrive. This last visit the host showed up, he never welcomed us.  He didn't even say hi. He just asked for the number in our party, said, "hold on, let me see if there's a table" and walked away, then returned with,  "over here" and proceeded to walk away. I'm smart so I figured out I was supposed to follow. The server had too much to drink the night before and said he was recovering so he wasn't on point. It was more than between five and 10 minutes before he arrived to take drink orders. Besides the fries, there were delays in getting drink refills, and long delays between checking in on us.

The food was good. My server was horrible though, her name is Tiffany. Like she seriously checked up on us three times while we were completely finished with our food and didn't offer us the check. Then when she gave us the check she just didn't do the whole "any desserts for you guys tonight". I got here at around 10, got seated around 10:15, then she took our orders. But then we didn't get our food until about 11. The food was already cold but I didn't complain because I just got off work and was starving. She wasn't tip worthy.

Sarah Was our waitress great service even when it got slammed in the bar. Drinks and apps on time and great waitress. She kept full attention on us and made sure our drinks and stomachs where never empty. Keep it up!

Location for this place is not that great, but once you gte in, then you feel different and you like it. I would recommend this place if you are having a party and getting together with freinds and family. The guy Andy is preety cool there. I wish they could work on the food a little bit.

This place needs intervention by Chef Ramsey. Or probably divine intervention by Jesus. I'm really sad that my experience there wasn't an episode of Kitchen Nightmares, because God knows I felt like that's what I was experiencing.  Biggest rule for anyone eating anything: IF YOUR BODY WANTS IT OUT IMMEDIATELY, THERE IS SOMETHING WRONG WITH IT. First you meet the horribly unprofessional and ill-mannered hosts/hostesses. That is, after you go seek them out to put you on a list, where the hell are they anyway?! They don't greet anyone! Wtf! Most of the time they were arguing with other hosts and servers. ARGUING LOUDLY. And there's no way to distinguish who is waiting, who has their name on a list, or anything because you're supposed to wait for your seat in the tiny doorway, so people are coming in asking us, "How do we get on the list?" Dear god. Then, as they are calling names, half of the people on there have already left anyway. But instead of going down the list, they cross the name off and walk away. Wtf? Empty tables, 15 people waiting. So we finally get seated and meet the only nice person there, our waitress. But then the food comes (not quickly). Oh noooooo... First, you have to pay for bread, which is the first indication of a horrible restaurant. The "garlic parmesan breadsticks" have NO seasoning, let alone cheese on them. I got better breadsticks at the pizza place outside of my high school. Then, my lemonade comes and it is MINUTE MAID. Ewww!! My date and I both ordered burgers. These weren't just ordinary burgers. THIS WAS BURGER SOUP! WOW. The bottom of the bun on both of our burgers were COMPLETELY soaked through, sopping pieces of bun that ripped as soon as we picked it up for the first bite.  Now, I'm not one of those people who is afraid of any kind of food, or afraid of certain textures or anything. And I DON'T have a queasy stomach. I eat Mexican and Indian food with no problem. So believe me when I say this food was DISGUSTING. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. I tried to eat it, I really did especially because they charge $12 for a damn burger. But less than halfway through, I had to go to the bathroom because my stomach wanted it out out out! Looking in the toilet I found that my shit looked just like the sopping mess that was on my plate. Lol. So instead of going back to my table, I had to get straight out the door of this terrible place. Even Denny's has burgers that are better and cheaper and more liable to stay intact than this shit was. I would rather eat Burger King than a burger from here.

Strawberry fields salad was amazing and jack daniels chicken strips are delicious.  But it seems every time I come here for drinks I am never happy. Ill stick to water from now on. Our server was cool so he made up for the crappy wrong drink.

I hadn't been here for year or so, but some things have changed. The most apparent one being, their prices seemed to have jumped from the average entree being around 12 dollars to around 18 now, and the food quality has stayed the same. I think their food is decent but if im having a 60 dollar dinner Id probably rather be at a nicer restaurant, not one that has a college bar vibe My drink (pomegranite cucumber cooler) tasted great but must have been pretty weak. I felt nothing from this drink and normally one drink is all I need for a nice buzz.  Speaking of the bar, our server really meant well when she apologized on the wait for our drinks and I appreciate her stopping by to apologize.  But next time you could leave it at: Sorry for the wait on those drinks. Not "Sorry for the wait on those drinks, one of our bartenders is really sick and had to leave early" um.... o_O do I need to take vitamin C after this drink?

If I could give it zero stars, I would. Worst service ever. "Bouncers" are rude and bartenders are unfriendly. I am so upset after just a 10 minute interaction with this establishment. I would not recommend this particular TGI Fridays to anyone!!!

This place is my go-to place when hungry late in the night. I love the the ambiance, everyone is there to catch a game and just relax with some bar bites or have a drink with some friends. It most definitely gets packed when a huge sports game is being shown other than that its not too shabby. The happy hour menu is bar seating only and that is usually open bar so first come first serve. The bar bites on the happy hour menu are so reasonable. All the appetizers are half-off and the sliders are only $1.50. Drinks are not more than $5. (what a steal) I always get the $5 margaritas and they are huge!! The sliders, chicken tenders, nachos, and the chicken wings are a frequent for me. By the end of the night I am completely satisfied.

When you walk in, prepare to be ignored. No smiles, no greeting.. If you DO get noticed at the front, you get blank stares.  Yes, from all 3 employees (2 girls and 1 guy) standing there. Umm hello, arent you supposed to ask me how many are in my party, or are you just really stoned right now?  Don't you realize there are many people who are unemployed and would love to have your job?  Sorry, I didn't realize it was THAT hard to be a hostess..!

we usually eat here twice a week! we are almost always greeted by lala...shes the best waitress in the bay area! she knows what we want and has our drinks in her hands as she seats us. ;) love her!   today? it was past 2pm and she was already leaving as we stood waiting at the door for 10minutes to be seated..mind you...its the middle of the week...215pm...there were only 6 other customers in the regular eating area. the floor was sticky and yes! i slipped on the crap left by the 4 extremely lazy employees! they were so busy chatting with each other, in the back pretending to be doing something...certainly werent getting our food and another one was actually using the business phone for a personal call! good grief! waitress only came to check back with us twice! horrible service! worst in bay area! im shocked that mario would let this happen since he is usually somewhere in the area. will never visit tgif after 2pm again! never! ever! i may also add...most of the employees were new!

horrible. We went there for late happy hour and arrived to an empty restaurant...awesome! We were greeted by an extremely unenthusiastic hostess who told us we couldnt sit at any of the empty booths in the bar, only the high top tables that hurt your back or the bar......okay... we chose to just skip happy hour and sit in the main dining area and that's where our problems began... We were given another server, who seemed to be in a bad mood....but I gave her the benefit of the doubt and was very polite when I placed my order....I ordered the stacked philly burger which features roast beef, peppers, and pickled vegetables on top of the burger.... we then went on about our business for the next 15 minutes waiting for our food to arrive.......  My girlfriend's food was fine, everything was cooked perfectly....but when i got my burger, I noticed it had bleu cheese, mushrooms, and onions and none of the toppings from the stacked philly...... they had given me the bleu cheese burger instead....  I was totally cool about it and just politely sent it back, when the manager came out to make sure everything was okay with me... I explained the situation, and  she offered me a salad while my new burger came out....i took the salad since my girlfriend's food was ready, so she wouldnt have to eat alone.... When they brought my burger back......to my shock....IT WAS THE SAME EXACT BURGER! Bleu cheese, mushrooms and all!! I immediately got the manager again, and she bends down next to me like I'm some kind of child, and explains that this was the burger I ordered, and often times customers wrongly send it back, but she was positive that this was how it came on the menu..... I had to have this manager bring me the menu, Break it down for her ingredient by ingredient including having to explain to her what giardiniera was (essentially explaining the ingredients to her own menu to her) I had to point out that there were green peppers on the philly, and mushrooms and bleu cheese in the other, and waste my breath arguing with the manager that I must have been wrong!! The manager then flipped her switch and started profusely apologizing and offered to remake my food herself (I'm sure so she could spit in it). I politely chose to leave without eating. Thanks, friday's!

Crappy Food combined with an equally crappy service. For Instance I ask the server "What kind of chicken dishes u got" Her Reply "I don't know U have to look into the menu yourself" with an attitude. We were 6 people and all that we ordered was stale and dry the one that stood out as the worst ever was Jack Daniel's chicken something worth $18.99 a plate which had a piece of stale rubbery chicken. Seriously TGIF u really got to look into something called "Quality and Value".
Just came back from here. Our server Kirsten was amazing. Had our table laughing the whole night. Great go-to place for drinks!

Ordered 60 bucks worth of food to go and let me tell yah.. It was pretty shitty.. No condiments or sauces for our appetizers.. Salads where awful.. How do u mess up a salad tho? Never will I order to go again !!

lets start with I ordered a french dip but when it came it didnt have the cheese, mushroom or onions as described. then my waitress was going to bring everything out on the side for my meat to get cold and build the sandwich myself. I will not come back here again.

Best happy hour food! Even better with the selection of hh drinks. Seriously, we always go overboard ordering food straight from memory here. Happy hour apps that's half off,  regular (big!) portions and extremely tasty? I'm so there. My regular menu: -chicken wings, sauce on the side. Always crispy and juicy! -beer cheese pretzels. Always comes out with crispy edges and piping hot. A fave. -$1.50 cheeseburger sliders. Love the char grilled taste, with cartelized onions. Makes it seem gourmet. -fries basket- simple, extremely cheap and good. - chicken quesadilla - large portion, pretty good. Can get a variety of good drinks for $3-5. Tip: try their Wednesday special. Rack of jack Daniels ribs for only $10.99 I think. Plus, add on a gigantic beer for $3. Love their fall off the bone ribs! Service isn't always prompt, but food and drinks never disappoint.
Updated: went there yesterday at midnight. According to Yelp, business closed at 12:30am. Boo to the rude old man for denying our service!

Poor service, poor food quality and quantity. Ordered a pasta meal and was shocked at the amount I got for the price I paid. Server never came around to refill glasses or check on our party. I had to finally waive her over. Also took a very long time for our food to come out and it was not busy. Won't be coming back here ever.

TGI Friday's is on of the better chain restaurants out of Applebee's, Chili's, etc. Their food is decent and I love their happy hour. I usually get their wings and some beers.  Service is a hit or miss. I've had excellent service even when it was super busy and I've had shitty service when it was slow and vice versa. It seems to always be busy and packed here.

Reading the reviews I can tell that TGI is consistent with one thing, horrible quality and quanity. I chose to dine in tonight because it was open late. I ordered a flounder, they didn't have any left I then asked to substitute for salmon but couldn't because " We cant subsitute because the flounder is sent to us like that" ok??? I thought we had moved on to salmon, guess I was wrong. Finally we were able to agree on a plate. When I received it I couldn't believe my eyes.  That price for THAT portion I think not. The chef's choice of vegetables was brocoli, and my plate had about three spoonfuls of rice. The salmon didn't have much flavor. Overall we left still hungry and unsatisfied and are now waiting on our IN N OUT order after agreeing we will never return. The management could of also done a better job, working at a restaurant myself I know for a fact my manager would of came to speak to an unhappy guest and gone out of their way to fix it. Keep your free dessert.

Went into celebrate my brothers birthday and we were disappointed in the food..all 4 of us all ordered the endless appetizers and were disappointed to find the food was (temperature) not hot enough potstickers...especially the spinach dip. It was warm and runny. Otherwise the service was great!

We were on our way to City Bistro and drove by TGIF and saw the BIG $10.99 Wednesday Full Rack of Ribs special so we decide to pull in.  It's been years possibly even a decade had passed since I stepped inside a Fridays. When I was still in school, I used to think the food here was bomb (most likely influenced by alcohol). The absence of alcohol, my family in front of me and years of developing a more sophisticated palette has led me to the conclusion that this place is no Bueno. (at least when it comes to the entrees).  I hope this Friday's nothing but the best. Every time I check the news you hear about a Friday's closing down. With very limited choices of places to enjoy a cocktail or some brews and take in a game in Union City, this place is sure to stay open for a while.
The food was mad good the air conditioning was too high but overall really good food just turn the ac down next time

Wife and I wanted to enjoy a "fatty day" so we were headed to Lowes and saw this place and we both thought that this chain had closed down since we hadn't seen on in years. We were greeted immediately and sat down. Our server, I forgot his name (we were there on Sunday the 3rd of August around 11:45) was quick to offer advice, get drinks and other "server duties". We ordered a ton of items, as I said we were having a "cheat day, to last the month"! The food was fine, it wasn't great but it hit the spot in terms of what we were craving...greasy goodness!! Our server was great, he had a personality and wasn't a robot at all, which is always good to see at these big chains! I'm sure the wifey and I will be back, or at least find another reason to go to Lowes so we can stop by here.

My husband and I went to Friday's in spite of the fact that their appetizers have gone totally down hill.  We decided to forgo the 1/2 price appetizers and just have cocktails.  We ordered margaritas regular flavored.  When they arrived, there was a random piece of an orange and a dried up slice of lime thrown on top.  Who puts old limes and oranges on a lime flavored margarita?  When I took a sip, it tasted like the bartender put water and a slice of lime in the blender, poured it into a glass and put crappy fruit on top.   We decided that this was the last straw.  We politely called over one of the waiters and advised him that the margaritas tasted like ice water slushes.  We also advised him that there was no way that the bartender could fix these drinks, and that we were leaving.  He didn't seem very surprised and just as politely said okay.   Mind you, these margaritas were going to be $6:00 each at the happy hour price.  For a good margarita this would have been a bargain, for the crap that Friday's served, it would have been highway robbery, had we paid.   We left and went to Chaplains, and had $4:00 house margaritas (3:30 - 6:30 happy hour), that were a 1000% better than the mess that Friday's served us.   I don't like to leave negative reviews, but this establishment should be ashamed.  The bartender should have been too embarrassed to serve a drink of this caliber.   Hopefully enough people refuse to tolerate this type of service and they either close or improve.

This is a horrible place to eat. We waited 35 minutes for our food. The food was cold, tasteless and overly greasy. The staff stood around talking instead of checking on their customers.. This visit was the worst restaurant experience ever!!!
#friday's is a can't lose place for great Food, & a great time, any night of the week, but especially on Friday's....

My GF and I were staying at the Holiday Inn Express which was around the corner from this place. And so we went in here not once, but twice! We went back to TGIF by default because we pretty much were convinced this place wouldnt let us down since one of the local seafood place dropped the ball on us the day before. And when we went to TGIF both times, we sat down right away and this is during dinner time during the week.  Noticed the bar was always full tho, but Im stoned cold sober now and am on the wagon so no sauce for me tonight. LOL!  We like to share, so when we order the entree's we just split it in half and get to enjoy two different entree's in one sitting.  But first of all the appetizer : TUSCAN SPINACH DIP is pretty darned good. We ordered it both times on both visits. Its yummy.  I think we might have even ordered a double for that. So on both occasions we ordered off the Jack Daniels menu. She ordered the JACK DANIEL'S® RIBS & SHRIMP and I was hungry and ordered the JACK DANIEL'S® MIXED GRILL* Hella good on both! Very tasty. My GF is from Beijing and this menu is one of her favorites when she comes stateside. Its a treat for her so she doesnt mind doubling up on it. LOL!  And for dessert, we shared the SALTED CARAMEL CAKE, that was good. The previous night we shared VANILLA BEAN CHEESECAKE Made with real vanilla beans, layered with white chocolate mousse and baked in a graham cracker crust. Topped with white chocolate shavings.  A little too sweet but washed it down with lots of water and a cup of coffee! LOL! This is a good place. Very quick service and the food gets to you quicker than the other places in that mall. Maybe the only other one is Appleby's, which I think is a notch down from this place IMO.  no complaints from us and this is from two different visits in the same week. Will go back here for sure and will recommend to anyone in the area.

This was my first time at TGIF and the food was decent... Appetizers were MUCH better than the burgers but decent nonetheless. (MAKE SURE YOU TRY THE TUSCAN SPINACH DIP!) Our waiter was very friendly and food came out fairly quickly considering it being dinner time and such.  Thanks Devin for being awesome!  Took off a star because of the table next to me.. Ugh! Super annoying!! Came in towards the end of our meal but that didn't matter - they were drunk in minutes and hitting on the other waitresses. Glad I didn't have her because she probably wouldn't have visited our table since all her time was with them!

I went here recently with a couple friends to grab some all-you-can-eat appetizers. We went in pretty late, proabably between 10pm and 11pm. Almost no wait to get seated, which was cool - and not always the case at this location. Everyone in the restaurant was just hanging out it seemed. Not much energy in the air, though. The hostess was nice enough to let us wait for a booth seat, and then take it once her busser was done cleaning it up. That got some brownie points, for sure :). However, we already knew what we wanted and we had no clue who our server was. We inquired with the hostess, who wasn't much help, then I asked another server to help us out and he said he'd let our server know. After a bit of waiting, I finally saw our server approach the booth next to ours, so we finally flagged her down...but then we had to wait while she prepped for a birthday at the table across from us. It took a really long time for her to get things ready and finally come out for the really short birthday song - quite unenethusiastic as those go by the way. Then she FINALLY come and took our order. At this point, we had been waiting about 20 minutes already... The fried mozzarella sticks were very good in my opinion, the buffalo wings were slightly above average. Better with the scorching hot sauce plus the buffalo sauce! The potato skins, however, were terrible. The three of us all started reminiscing about Elephant Bar's potato skins ON THE SPOT! Pass on the potato skins - they're  HUGE let-down! After the huge disappointment, our server was nice enough to let us get the Bruschetta, which was SURPRISINGLY GOOD!!! I usually hate bruschetta, especially from places like this. It's usually too stale with not enough good toppings. The bread was just right, and the toppings were very good, especially the tomatoes. The server stepped it up for sure after the long wait, and a couple of the items were quite good, so this balanced out to 3 stars for me.

Let me start off with that I like TGI Friday's. I just had a bad visit here - got the lobster tail & steak and chips & spinach dip. Lobster tail tasted burned. Steak was fine. Chips tasted stale and old. Service is slow, despite it not being busy.

I love this place because of the customer service! It was a pleasure coming because the lady was really nice and helpful with what to get. Overall good place, clean and nice. Although at the end waiter went MIA

LORRAINA SHOULD BE FIRED! I have never felt so unwanted and ignored by my server/bartender. We got a weak greeting, waited forever for her to pour our drinks because heaven forbid she not finish her conversation with friends first. Then had to bother someone else to get our food order in, she knew we wanted to order but never came back to us till it was time to give us the bill. She was fishing for a tip. Oh I definitely wrote her a note tip at the top of my bill.

Been here a handful of times and I usually don't review chains but today was terrible. Only come here because my boyfriend loves the jack Daniels sauce more than the actual steak. Five o'clock on a Wednesday you think it wouldn't be bad... We were wrong. It wasn't full and there was no wait. Took 15 minutes for a server to acknowledge us, another ten to get our drinks, and our food came out half an hour. That's almost an hour to see food from time of arrival. Bf ordered steak medium rare and it came out well done. We asked for it to be replaced and it took another 20 minutes. I won't go into details about what I ordered, but my Mac and cheese side was f$&@!n penne with bread crumbs!!! There were more pieces of penne noodles than shreds of cheese! The cheese was basically sprinkled on to penne noodles and melted... So once the cheese was gone it was plain old penne noodles again, what the fork?! To get a to go box for our potato skin leftovers- the only things decent took forever and so did the check and getting the card back. I know chains can't hire some world class experienced servers but I'm sick of these kids foolin around with my meal time! FYI I've served In a restaurant before and I know the hard labor it takes to keep one running but these kids man, I would never not tip but they are pushin it!

Swung by before heading to the movies on 9/9/14 - we had the options to sit either at the bar or the high tables. We chose the bar because I wanted to watch the game and get my drinks faster. We ordered some buffalo wings and a couple budweisers from the HH menu. Thinking we'd make the movies on time ..  For a first time EVER at a TGIF's .. this place proved EVERYTHING anybody has ever said in regards to the chain to be true. Food is bland and overpriced .. that's about it. It has a bar and the ambiance looks a little higher quality than applebee's but .. that's about it.  Buffalo Wings - I looked at it a good minute before eating it .. and that's a good minute on top of already being late for the movies. So it's from some scrawny chicken - that's fine. I think they oven roast it then twirl it around in some buffalo sauce .. because the drumsticks and wings weren't just small, they were pretty much dehydrated and on their way to being burnt, too.  Service - The girls were nice. They didn't seem to care for being at work, though. Smiled and everything but it was late and they were working - it just makes sense.  Left the place leaving a 20something % tip because our bartender/server was really nice and did her best to smile every time she asked us if we were okay. I wouldn't come back for the food though .. ever. I made the choice of ordering buffalo wings saying " you can't go wrong with buffalo wings. no matter where you go. " - I now stand corrected.

Came here recently just to try their Unlimited Appetizers promo going on, and was like "I got my group of friends, why not?" Strike 1: Each person could only order 1 unlimited appetizer, and it was $10 each, for only unlimited refills of that one appetizer.  What's with the fine print, Felicia?  Dang.. Strike 2: The appetizers took very long to come out.  It didn't help that there was a birthday party RIGHT next to our table, so we couldn't hear each other talk or flag down someone easily to ask about the wait. Strike 3: They weren't even good!  We got the bruschetta, potato skins, cheese sticks, and wings.  Of all those, I only liked the wings, so I guess that's safe..   As for the others, the bruschetta was nasty, the potato skins were hella skimpy (don't recall potato skins being potato wedge with a tiny bit of cheese and 1 tiny piece of bacon).  The cheese skins were only okay.  Not coming back if I were the hungriest person alive.  Because I would die before getting my food!

The service is soooo bad. Their food is not all that good either but the dessert is good. The service really got to me, it seems like the employees don't want any customers to walk in and kill the "free time" they have. What I don't understand is who the hell is the manager here? I walked in Tuesday afternoon and there was no host to seat me. A few employees were just chatting up in the corner staring at me while I was tryna figure out if I should just seat myself, walk out??? Or just go to the bar area?, or are they even open for service???? The manager should put in some effort to fix this issue.

Waited almost a half an hour for an waiter, Received my drink with a dead fruit fly, and most importantly, waited almost a hour my check .... Not going there again Jack Daniel burger was good, too bad it had poor service to come with it..

This was the second time we have visited this restaurant and I have to say it's not up to the standard I am accustomed to from a Friday's. When we walked in the hostess tried to push us into the bar for happy hour. When we refused, she rolled her eyes and seat3d us right next to a large group with a child's birthday party with a lot of empty tables other places in the place. Then it took our server over 15 minutes to acknowledge us and get our drink order. We received our drinks and then our soups. Still no silverware or napkins. Had to flag our server down to get utensils. No refills on drinks. Food was decent. Not sure if I'm willing to return here. We will see.

Sigh I understand it's late, but there shouldn't be a reason we should have to  1) wait 20 minutes for water 2) practically be unassisted the whole time we were here 3) have to wait days for a refill on apps especially when it's not busy. I'm only upset cause I work in a restaurant that's much more understaffed and hectic. I'd get my ass CHEWED for not dropping off water within 2 minutes. I'd be in even more shit if I didn't pay attention to my guests and didn't give them refills especially when they're hella obviously looking at everyone for refills.  Wow soooo originally I was going for 2 stars but now I'm gonna go with NO STARS. Sorry Edgar. It's not cool to be rude to guests and not listen to what we have to say. I understand it's late but dude. Trust me. It's still not acceptable. I never really make these typa posts but hey. Upset guests gotta say something for the world to know. Also Edgar. Please tell us that the sliders aren't unlimited. I mean cmon we did walk in and asked the first time around. So please TGIF. Listen to us. Lol  NO STARS.

I have to say that I really like the bartenders but the service you get when seated is less than par. We ordered some drinks at the bar and some appitizers while we waited almost 45 minutes for a table on a relatively slow day. We wanted a table around the bar area but was seated right by the bathroom and it took 1 hour for some buffalo wings which came out wrong the first time and we had to wait another 20 minutes for the right ones to come.  If you sit at the things come out better and faster...

My last visit at fridays was awesome! My waitress was halarious and she made us feel important. She also had this other waitress working in the bar area with her ... They were so funny together. Great service they love their jobs and they know how to have fun with it! Thank u Jalaine and tammy for a wonderful evening... They made this restaurant feel like it was our own private party!!:-)

My friends wanted to run in for a quick bite and beverage...so I am like, "ok."  We get to Friday's and it is so crowded, like always, but we show ID and make our way through.  Found a spot at the bar, ordered drinks, food and got ready to watch SNF. I do not really eat the food here, but I do like the people who work here.  The atmosphere is friendly, busy, loud and welcoming.   I have played dominoes here with my friends Tony and Juan many nights at the bar, and the people who work here have always treated us well. Stephani Smiles for TGIF ;)

THE WORST SERVICE IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD! Don't go here if you actually want to eat a good meal and pay a good reasonable price for what you getting. If you like waiting then this is the restaurant for you!

This review is about Edgar for his unwelcoming and poor service.  I arrived at this location for a quick late night meal. It was 2 hours before closing on a weekday, it was not busy at all. The place itself was clean and the environment was welcoming.  My friend and I were immediately seated and given menus by Edgar. He returned shortly with our orders of water and while we were still obviously looking at our menus, rushed us by asking what we wanted. After politely explaining to him that more time was needed, he left us alone for a full 15 minutes (yes I timed this) and by the time he returned I was starving. Again, keep in mind that this was not a busy night. I ordered my sirloin medium and was returned with a well-done tough piece of meat that had obviously been sitting out. The reasons I have for this is that 1) the jack Daniels burger my friend ordered was beyond soggy, room temperature, and falling apart when he received his and 2) my sirloin was room temperature and felt like it had just been warmed up. The lack of quick execution of our meal was no big deal to me at first because hey, everyone has a bad day right? Again, Edgar proved his incompetence by leaving us alone for the rest of the night, walking past our table several times and being unaware that we were ready for our check. After we finally received the bill did I see any pleasantries from this gentleman, which made me feel as if he were happy we were finally leaving or happy that he was about to receive his tip.  It takes a lot to bother me and I still provided  Edgar with a tip that I soon realized should not have been given to him at all.  As my friend and I walked to our car, I looked through a window on the left side of the restaurants main entrance. Who do I see? Edgar with his hand inappropriately groping his girlfriends ass while watching the basketball game. He may have been on his break or off work, but displaying this conduct out in the open where customers can assume the worst is unprofessional. Images of his hands touching my food made me cringe. For crying out loud, have you no shame Edgar? Is this behavior okay for you to present to young children who may walk by at any second? Is this the reason why your service was terrible and had a lack of speed? This is what made me upset and prompted me to write a review. Edgar is an embarrassment to this restaurant, so much that I would never think to revisit this place or any other tgi Friday's restaurants. Usually one person doesn't make me hate a place because that seems unfair, but it makes me so angry to know that this man is still hired and allowed to tarnish a restaurants reputation.  It's sad to see that I am not the only one who has had much to say about this gentleman either.  Fellow patrons, please beware.

Ordered Jack Daniels ribeye medium rare.  No jack sauce on it AT ALL and it was raw in parts.  Gristle and marbling are not the same thing and this was gristly and chewy piece of meat with huge chunks of chewy fat.  Part of dinner was baked potato where I asked for all toppings on the side.  No sour cream??! That's weird. Also ordered hot wings as an appetizer and it all came out together.  Seriously?  Tough tough tough to get good service in Newark, Fremont, Union City, Milpitas, Hayward.  I'm so disappointed because, done right, the Jack Daniels dishes are great. I'd pass

Both of the time that I was here, I've always left satisfied. The food itself is great, first time i got the afredo, forgot what its called but it was the one with "fav" next to it. It was okay, nothing really special about it. Second time I got the rib eye with a side of sautéed shrimp with fries and mash potato. It was great but mainly because of the fries. I don't know why but I'm just in love with their fries. It's so tasty and different. My boyfriend thought it was okay but i'm fuckin in love with it. Service was alright, could be better. Barely check up on us and it was quite slow. The Long Island tasted different, don't really like it but every bartender has a different way of making it so I'm sure someone else will probably like it. Other than that this place is not bad and I'm sure i will come back, mainly for the fries.

The bartenders are so nice, but when I order a sizzling platter and it is borderline warm, no pop no steamy smell.. Cmon guys. That's why you order that entree, for the sizzle. I took it home and threw it in the microwave. Total buzz kill.

I used to frequent this Friday's A LOT as a high schooler. Coming back, the memories of looking forward to those sweet sweet margaritas are long gone. I used to eat some of their items with pleasure as at that time maybe Friday's paid their workers better. After my experience today, it's safe to assume their quality has plummeted.  Came in here right after a movie for lunch, and boy, I thought working fast food was crap but to express it on your face is worse. Walked in to two workers, maybe hosts (?) and I felt bad for how empty her face was. It was a Sunday morning, so I guess the church rush ended but to have no life in your eyes when you greet customers? Damn. Must really hate working here.  Anyway, me and the boyfriend were seated promptly and greeted enthusiastically by Tatiana. She was sweet. Placed our drink orders and waited no more than 10 mins. Mind you, it was dead. We got the drinks and I ordered a frozen strawberry margarita. I tasted ice slush and strawberry flavorings.  Yeesh. I'm not one to complain; I grin and bear it. But either way, wow. That's bad. Boyfriend got a beer, can't review because, come on, how do you ruin what's on tap? I had the 6 oz. Sirloin, medium, cut it open and grimaced. It was like I cooked it. Clearly the chef didn't watch enough Food Network or even read his menu because medium has a pink center. I saw none of the sort. I thought it was the lighting so I took a bite. Nope, tasted well done. So much for flavor.  I had the side of cheddar mac and cheese with mashed potatoes. How could you ruin either? Taters were fine, but the mac and cheese was dry. I felt like I was eating a lunchables equivalent. Blegh.  Tatiana was attentive and with her customer service she deserves better than to represent a failing franchise. Don't go here.

Today. December. 4th. 2014. At 8pm i wanted to try something. New so i went with my wife and 2kids.  we didnt even get the drinks. It took 10minutes. And nobody came so we left. Thats really sad because their was alot of people working and nobody came to even say the waiter will be with you or anything... They should put more people so they can give a better service:-(
Garlic breadsticks had no garlic. Lemonade had ice all the way to top of glass. Salad has watered down ranch. Plates were never cleared.

Went here once with my mom and had chicken tenders and fries and she had a salad I believe. Service was slow, whatever no biggie.  Went again with my husband a few months ago and everything was awful! Both of our knives and forks were filthy, posted pictures already.  We sat in the front where severs go to get drinks and we were annoyed that the severs used that as a hangout spot to sit and gossip. There was always a crowd of severs over there. One girl was off the clock, I'm assuming, and was grabbing herself and her friends drinks. No one seemed to know how to close the door to the ice, which was right below the soda dispenser and there was a lot of crap falling into it.  We got a sampler platter as an appetizer with mozzarella cheese sticks, potato skins, and boneless buffalo things. The ABSOLUTE WORST I've ever had in my life. The cheese sticks weren't ooey gooey, the potato skins were over cooked and bland and the buffalo things were just as bad. The food was even hot.  I ordered steak and lobster tail, there was no flavor to the steak and it was grey(????). the lobster tail wasn't terrible, but not that great. My husband had a steak and mashed potatoes, same problem. Our waiter checked on us a few times and didn't bother checking to see that we needed more water. We watched him socialize the entire time while we were eating with the rest of his coworkers.  Now I see why so many of these restaurants closed.

Benjamin the waiter is the best!  We had a party of 16 and he remained calm and extremely attentive. I will always ask to have him as our waiter.  Good food and he made our experience beyond awesome.  We were still taking about him when we left.  VOGUE

This place was pretty bad. When we first got here the hostess was sitting outside on the phone. So we stood inside for a few minutes before she came to ask us where we wanted to sit. We sat at a booth and ordered some appetizers before our friends arrived. When they arrived we realized that the booth wasn't big enough for all of us so we told our waitress we were going to switch tables. She said it was fine but we were going to have a new server.  So we moved tables and no one let anyone know that we had moved so we sat around waiting for about half an hour before asking the hostess if she could find out waitress. Another 15 minutes and we asked one of the other waitresses if we could order who also told us just to wait a minute to find her. Once we found her she promptly apologized for not coming since she saw our appetizers and thought we had been served already.  She was great and nice. But after already waiting almost an hour just to be served the food took way too long. Then for some reason they decided to turn up the volume on the music so loud that we had to yell at each other.  None of the other waitresses seemed to be doing anything that didn't involved their own tables. When we left they were all standing in a circle by the front door just chit chatting and no one greeted or said bye to anyone in our group.

Was waiting in line for seating, waited for about 20, but we decided not to go since the wait. Never even got to talk a employee. OK is you are able to wait. Not for kids, because most people are drunk

Came here for the first time! It was delicious! The server was very nice our food was spectacular. Was a party of 6 all our steaks were very flavorful and juicy, veggies and baked potatoes so good. We went during the week it was empty so maybe that had to do with it. I'd go again!
I love this place because it reminds me of my favorite song, Rebecca Black's "Friday"

I remember coming to Union Landing a lot during high school, and even now, it's the to-go place for my friends back home in Hayward. It was close enough to my high school and now it's where all the food is. There's not really places to hang out in Hayward, and here, we get a movie theatre and several food options.  Choosing TGIF was kind of a spontaneous decision amongst my group of 10 and we came in at around 4. The wait was around 5 mins even though there was literally no one there... we were seated and served pretty well, until we ordered. Food took forever to arrive, around 30 minutes despite not being rush hour. I was a bit disappointed honestly. I expected food to be of somewhat decent quality, but their brocolli on my dragonfire shrimp wasn't fresh. Rice was of questionable quality too. My friend ordered the firecracker shrimp and her cole slaw just looked like someone pulled it from the bottom of the fridge. Needless to say, I probably won't be coming back due to severe quality issues. The food was a bit pricy for the poor quality as well.

The reviews are horrible for service here which is kinda sad. I've been here many times over the years and I always have a good experience on my visits.    Today was no different as we were greeted then shortly after seated by shareen. Shareen was our server and has amazing customer service skills. Once we were seated she asked if we already had an idea of what we wanted to drink. Shareen told us to take our time and let her know when we were ready to order...she walked by several times making sure she was visible.    As soon as we were ready to order, shareen was available. She took our order and made sure it was manicured to our liking(no sesame seeds please).    I ordered my usual sesame jack chicken strips with extra sauce and no sesame seeds, my friend got the Parmesan crusted chicken with mac n cheese, and the Parmesan crusted meat balls. The food came 15 minutes after we ordered. The food was fresh and tasty as always. We ordered another drink(non alcoholic) when we were finished eating with to go boxes...our waitress shareen asked if we wanted to go cups for our drinks and I thought that was pretty cool as I didn't know there were to go cups there. That was never offered before and we have left many barely touched drinks before :) Cheers to another good experience. The full 5 is for Shareen and her service.

I WOULD GIVE THIS PLACE NO STARS!! Hostess was no where in site when we arrived. My daughter had to ask a waiter if we should seat ourselves. Finally a girl came and never apologized. The waiter was worse, he didn't care how long we waited. Oh and we were the only guests at the door. So it's not like we went during a busy time. This staff is awful. We will never spend money at TGIF.

This place has gone way downhill. I used to really like it. I got the chicken fingers and they were extremely dry. Even my side salad wasn't that great. It was probably one of the worst restaurants meals I've had in awhile. The prices have gone up but the quality has gone down. Overall disappointment.

We did it to ourselves, really. But who am I to argue when the phrases "unlimited appetizers" and "gift card" are combined? That's how Boyfriend, myself, and a mutual friend of ours ended up here on a Monday night for dinner. We ordered the baked potato skins unlimited appetizer and then, sadly, each of us also ordered an entree as well. The potato skins were over-fried to the point that they were beyond crispy -- they were essentially burnt. We only got 2 plates (though we could've had unlimited plates) of them because they were so hard to eat. Our friend's Jack Daniel's burger wasn't cooked enough to her taste (she asked for medium-well, I believe) so she only ate about half of it. My parmesan-crusted chicken was stiff and dry. The mac and cheese was okay, so I ate that, but I was pretty weirded out by the "fresh tomato and mozzarella salad." I didn't think it would literally be little cherry tomatos and globs of mozzarella cheese (looked like they had used the cold insides of their mozzarella sticks). I think Boyfriend ordered the Jack Daniel's chicken sandwich and he was disappointed by the lack of chicken in the sandwich (there was so much more bread than there was meat). I used to come here for late-night drinks and appetizers to share with groups when I was younger (see: freshly 21) and they seemed alright then. Maybe I've just grown up and my tastes have changed. We had the gift card, so we had to use it. But I don't think I'll be back unless it's on someone else's dime (and even then I'd probably think about it pretty hard first).

For once,  my server wasn't slow. However,  she brought me the wrong drink then took forever to bring the correct one. It came after my food was brought out. Also, order just ice cream for my niece and that also came after our food. When we sat,  table was dirty with crumbs and under the table was hella smooshed food. The music was so dang loud...it's a family restaurant not a night club!!! And the bathroom...stall had no toilet paper and the garbage was over flowing with paper towels. This location is always busy so going out of business is probably not a concern but come on, get some better service and keep ur restaurant clean.

We went here last night. I ordered the jack Daniels mixed grill (steak an half slab ribs) I asked for another half slab since I knew my guy would want some too. He ordered a chicken cease salad an a french dip. I should have known when the server brought his soda out wrong that the dining experience was going to suck... He ordered a sprite no ice... got ice.. taken care of right away... my drink took over 20 mins... fast forward to getting our food... my order came out full slab of ribs no steak. When I question it I'm told that I can't add a half slab to my order so the server just put in a full slab without the steak.. I am soo upset I just wanted to leave. I told them to box up my food. They add on the steak. Told them to box that up too. The person who delivered our food was insistant that they dont offer what i ordered... server comes by and says no reason to be upset my order is being cooked..My guy never got his french dip. Got the bill and it wasn't even on there. He asked for the manager. Manager came and listened. Said that our server was a trainee. If he's a trainee why wasn't he following a more experienced server? Long story short. Manager comped what I ordered and the French dip and a drink. Which is why they get one star. I doubt I will ever go back...
The food was cold and took about 20 minutes to get my beer. Waiting area very small inside and outside uncovered so don't go when its cold or raining on a weekend.

Came on valentine's day after a movie, about 10 pm. Expected a mad rush and weren't disappointed. We're fine with servers being busy, but not slow. The female bartender moved a glacial pace. It took at least 10 minutes for her to take our drink order and another 10 to get them. We ordered 3 appetizers which took at least a half hour to get to us; two were overcooked and had clearly been sitting under heat lamps for at least 15-20 minutes and one was undercooked. Couldn't finish the food; I guess it's lucky we weren't that hungry. Got the inedible food taken off the tab but it still took 10 minutes for the bartender to look our way and see we were ready to leave. There has to be somewhere better than this to go after a movie!

I was there tonight 2-27-15...I sat in the entrance for 20 minutes, waiting for service...during that time, I watched the 'host', talk bad about the customers, give away shots to employees, and be a complete juvenile punk bitch...when I asked for management, she was quick to defend him, without even hearing my side...the red tie dude was a prick...I offer a zero star rating...especially against the dope fiend manager who obviously didn't care.

Last time I was here was in 2011, so I can say that I haven't been to a TGIF's in years...literally. My younger sister and I just finished having dinner at around 9:30 PM at Tadamasa so we decided to go walk at Wal-Mart and buy some thank you cards to send out for our mom's wedding from last week.  We bought our cards and decided to stay at that McDonald's to write the cards so we can get them out of the way.  While we were there, we had a few unwelcome visitors stop by so as soon as we were done with the last card, we hurried our little behinds out of there and started searching for a nearby spot to hang out and chat.  When we found out that TGIF doesn't close until 1:30 AM, we made our way over. As soon as we both walked in, we were sweetly greeted by the hostess.  She was about to show us to our table, but since we had just eaten, we just asked if it would be ok for us to just sit at the bar.  She looked at us and smiled.  She told us she'll check and brought back a guy to check our ID's.  We were both surprised, and thought she was so cute that we'd need to be carded since my sister and I are both in our 30's.  She already gets 5-stars right off the bat.  Lol Once we made our way to the bar, we were sweetly greeted by our bartender, Rabi.  He asked us what we wanted to drink and I asked for a virgin pina colada and my younger sister asked for a vanilla shake.  He was probably thinking "what the heck are these women ordering?"  Lol But he was so sweet and just smiled and told us he would have our drinks in a few minutes.  I don't think they normally even make vanilla shakes, but he made it for us any way... We ordered two appetizers, even though we already had dinner not too long ago.  The bacon mac n cheese bites was on the salty side, but the Tuscan spinach dip was actually good.  Although the tostada strips smelled like it was deep fried in old cooking oil. I would normally rate the food at a 2, but the service definitely kicks it up to a 4-star.  Being that we were seated at the bar and ordered non alcoholic beverages, the bartender was still sweet and friendly.  He checked on us multiple times to make sure we were doing alright and according to my younger sister, she says "we'll definitely be back if Rabi is working."  Lol

This should have been 1 star.. But I gave them 2 stars because they are generally good.. Defiantly better than the kind of service I got..  I like tgif.. And I love the location of this place.. I generally come here on sat/Friday nights For food and drinks..Robbie always serve me... He is a nice guy and always does a good job.. But this time he wasn't there. I couldn't catch the names of the bartenders..one of them was  a very attractive girl and the other was a guy with a ghotti..But they were busy having their own conversation.. With a bunch of other employees.. The side that I sat by.. Was still dirty from the previous customers.. The lady eventually got to me after awhile.. Then she was gone.. After awhile she came back..I wasn't the only one in need of service... the people next to me were looking for someone to serve them too.. But the bartenders and the employees continued their conversation..  At the end they actually costed themselves the tip..I realized that I shouldn't be there on nights when Robbie is not there..
Steak and lobster: steak way over cooked. Lobster was ok. Service wasnt much better. Wouldnt go there again. If your waiting for wild wings or something just stick it out. Its worth it.
This place is sucks no service at all and food is pathetic pls guys go some where else

Happy Hour wasn't correctly advertised so getting there and finding that out was not the greatest surprise. The Jack Daniel's chicken was very good it was the first item on the top left corner of the Jack Daniel's items page. Garlic fries were sitting in a base of oil which made all of the fries on the bottom very oily and inedible. Not worth it for the regular prices but for happy hour I would come back.
If I could give negative stars I would, 30 minutes waiting and the waiter never came to take our order!!! Very very disappointed

Went to this location for lunch and the hostess was visibly yawning and looked like she didn't want to be there. Was with my wife and 2 kids, so a booth is pretty much mandatory for us whenever possible. She brought us to a table with chairs, so we asked if we could get a booth. She quickly responded that she has no booths and walked away. That's it. No "sorry, we don't but if you don't mind waiting we can get one for you" or something along those lines. We looked at each other and decided to go eat at Chili's instead.  The one star was for the hostess, not the food. Not sure if we'll be back anytime soon since that left a bad taste in our mouths...

Wow! The teenagers that run this joint really don't give a rats ass!! Our server looked like she hated her job. We were in a great mood when we sat down. Ready to spend some money and drink some silly drinks. Sadly we didn't get to order any because she never came by to get our drink order. When we went to the bar instead, we got told that they don't like to serve people who have tables. Really? You just lost $35 bucks +tips. Look, I am not the one to leave bad reviews but COME ON! People come here to spend money, eat food and drink silly cocktails so treat them with some respect. Don't ruin people's experience. I am sorry I came here tonight. Do yourself a favor: if you hate your job so much then Quit or try harder to be better at it. I wish I can give no starts.

I don't know what else to say but absolutely slow service on a very busy Sunday noon. They need more servers period and it didn't help that our server had no sense of urgency (I think he's new). I also had the pleasure of seeing a couple walk in and walk out within 10 min cause no one greeted them. There were 3 servers in the bar and each had about 6 tables (poor servers). How would they make good tips when their service sucked (unless they're playing the numbers game lol). Even saw buss boys serve drinks lol. Where is the manager? Shouldn't he be walking around greeting tables? We did see him on our way out running food, how convenient. This lunch experience just was unacceptable probably won't come back here for lunch.

Food was great! My daughter & I ordered the steak & lobster. Steak was perfectly cooked. Lobster was steamed just right. I'm not sure why this restaurant received such bad reviews. It was my first time eating at this restaurant but my daughter has eaten there before and has not had a bad experience. We had absolutely no wait when we arrived. The waiter was a little slow bringing my son his milkshake after asking him for it a few times but other than that, we had a great overall experience.

I've never had a server roller eyes at me after they forgot my order. My table of 9 waited 40 minutes for their food and my order was forgotten as well as the birthday girls. There was no apology and no further service from this waitress after asking why my steak was overlooked. Terrible service. A lot of the servers sat a few tables down from us texting on their phones the entire time.

This experience was awful. The waitress ignored us on many occasions while the guests beside us got all the attention.  It took 20 mins between unlimited appetizers and then the waitress didn't want to put in the next series of appetizers. We asked for more napkins but never got them. We ordered kids pasta but got pizza instead. It took 30 mins to get a kids meal. Maybe short staffed. But clearly not a place i would come back to. Finally we got our paper towels out of the bathroom. Would love to hear from the owner regarding this place.
The service is extremely painstakingly slow!  We waited 10 min for our waiter, then another 15 just for our drinks.

We had a server named Veronica. Worst server ever. We asked for JD sauce and she never brought it. I had to go to the kitchen and ask someone there.. we asked for refills, we waited 15 minutes... got fed up and I asked another server to get our drinks, and he said, let be get your server... instead of helping us get drinks. Then we asked for our bill and it took another 10+ minutes for veronica to close out our bill. Glad to have left, and am never coming back! #worstcustomerservice

I enjoy coming here most of all we makes friends with the employees we always come back cuz of Lala she's nice sweet and friendly she's always quick multi tasking she was was not in a good mood cuz her manager kept poking her buttons but she kept her cool and kept us costumers happy not rude or mean but her manager... Someone should talk to that manager she was rude mean and if she had a problem she could've taken her to the office and talked to her about it cuz everyone heard how rude she was to lala and that wasn't professional I love Fridays but the manager was wrong for what she did... Plus food and prices are awesome

The servers seem to dislike their jobs ( in my opinion). It was lunchtime and not very crowded and the food still took forever to come out. Forget about someone checking up on you, I had to hunt down an employee so I could pay my bill and leave.

Today was one of the worst experiences that I have had a TGI Fridays in Union City. My server's name was Tatiana she got both orders wrong and we has to wait 15 minutes for silverware and condiments. Then it didn't get any better because the food was gross.

This review is only for their endless appetizers deal. It's the only reason to visit TGI Friday's other than for their booze because otherwise you'd spend too much for mediocre food that you can just get in the frozen food section of any grocery store. Endless choice apps for 12 bucks a person. They really are endless, and the servers don't judge you, and they make sure to keep the apps coming quickly. It's very nice for a fattie like me. I mean, foodie. Yeah, foodie. The downside is that not all of their appetizers are available on the endless apps menu, it seems like the best appetizers are left out (pretzel sticks, sliders, bone-in wings).  Good apps: Any of the boneless wings, mozzarella sticks, potato skins. Bad apps: Chicken tostada (really terrible) and potstickers (overly salted mystery meat).

So I have been coming here for 10 years now! The staff has changed over the years but has stayed pretty consistent. The food has been up and down over the years. There happy hours are OK. The entertainment (TVs) are better than most. I think this place can use a little better management skills. The costumer service department needs season vets to teach these young workers how to serve a little better. This place is roomy and has an outdoor patio. I will continue to come here on principle and the fact that I live right by the place. Ha

Food is pretty good. My bf loves string beans and the string beans fries (appetizer) were good, his fav! He also got a bacon burger. It was delicious he said. I didn't get anything because I wasn't hungry. Our waitress was nice. She made our visit enjoyable. Bf made me tip her $6 for his $18 lunch! I guess she deserves it :)

Okay soooo my experience was great. Perfect server he was on top of everything! He was refilling our drinks, constantly asking us how The food was... It was great. Half off appetizers, come on people don't expect this place to be super fancy it's TGIF, expect what you know to expect then rate from that... The appetizers were cooked amazingly surprisingly!!! It was a great night to go. Happy hour of course. I wouldn't come another time. For 6 drinks (non happy hour) and 6 apps happy hour it came out to 100$ for 3 people. Not bad.

Came here at 945 and they close at 11pm. They told us the kitchen was already closed last call was at 930pm. That's still an hour and a half before they close. Are you kidding me? We ended up going across the street where the restaurants kitchen closes the same time the entire restaurant does. Horrible!

Coming here for the unlimited apps is a hit and miss. They are extremely skimpy on the ingredients and they are not how they advertise. Potato Wedges are wedges of deep fried slices of potatoes with little cheese and maybe a green onion or two. They also taste as if they where pulled out of the freezer and thrown in the fryer. Very unappetizing. Sitting at the bar, it seem like after the first beer and serving of our first and second serving of apps, we became invisible and literally had to wave dramatically to get out bar keeps attention. As for the reason why we came here, to watch the playoff game(WARRIORS), they were very accommodating in putting that on and tuning in with the sound so I give them one star for that. ;)

Horrible service in the bar area especially the Latina bar tender with the 1990's hair style. Her attitude and hair style had me taken back. The manager is extremely nice, but has no control of his staff.  I probably wouldn't come back.

Horrible, I originally ordered to eat at the bar, but had to leave early and asked for it to go.  What i got when i got to the house and looked at it , was a freaking joke.  Two thin chicken dry chicken breasts, 5 freakin shrimp covered in mediocre marinara sauce and a slice of semi melted american cheese.  $16 for less food that I could have from a hungry man dinner?
These guys need to replace the menu  for cocktails(happy to make it for you)..worst cocktails ever had good customer service food not bad

Went out for dessert at almost 21:00... A ten-minute wait regardless. Out of Oreo Madness. The Ultimate Strawberry Shortcake had the flavored sauce but no strawberries; the pound cake was refrigerated and hard. Vanilla Bean Cheesecake was not too sweet. Service was friendly.

Ridiculous service!!! Within the last year, we've probably came to here a handful of 15 times and each time, we've become even more disappointed, therefore this place is not on our go-to list anymore. It's happened a couple times where we walk in, I go up to put my name on the list and the hosts are either chit-chatting with each other or they just aren't paying attention and I literally have to stand there until I'm noticed. I've also been seated toward the back of the restaurant where there's a cash register and I've heard some of the waiters/waitresses gossiping in the back. I've also experienced where we've ordered, our waiter drops off our food and leaves and comes back just to give us the bill, like come on. I shouldn't have to get up and chase down someone to find my waiter for a refill. I have no idea what the mangers are thinking hiring such unprofessional staff. I'm extremely disappointed and won't be spending my money on bad service.

It's Monday night and it seems likes there's only one waiter  working the floor. We waited awhile for anyone to come and offer us drinks. Once we got attened, the waiter was polite and refilled our drinks promptly. Now for the food... we ordered a rare burger with some fries. I've posted a picture of my WELL DONE burger with 20 fries..... Literally 20 fries....

First of all the front hostess is an idiot, i ask for a booth and they gave me a middle table, then i told the girl  i saw an empty booth then she said ohh i did not see it, then she seat us down and for more than 10 minutes nobody came to ask if we need it somothing  to drink or eat took for ever service sucks in here. Honestly  i probably will think twice to come over to this crappie place...

I came here for the endless appetizer deal, but they discontinued it! So sad. I was just here a month ago when they had it.  I sat at the bar area yesterday and the waitress was super nice and attentive. I wish I remembered her name!! But I definitely come here for their happy hour. Half off appetizers. Woot woot! Anything else on their food menu is pretty pricy for the quality.

My boyfriend and I usually come here because it's the closest location to us. Our first visits weren't short of what was expected. We came in, got seated, server took our order, we ate, and we left. Typical restaurant visit.  On our last visit to TGIF, we had the most awful experience. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted. I didn't think anything of that. It took the host a while to seat us and I had no idea why. There were so many tables open. We didn't feel welcomed. It was BLAH to say the least.  Our server, Ericka, paid absolutely no attention to us. She walked really fast past our table a few times. No smile. No greetings. Nothing. Just "what can I get for you?" I was thankful that the food came out fast, but after two bites of my food, she came by with our check. My boyfriend and I felt rushed. We wanted to enjoy our dinner. We never order dessert at restaurants and that night was one of the rare nights that we wanted dessert. After about five minutes, she came back and asked if we wanted anything else, as if she didn't just put the check on our table. We didn't feel like getting dessert anymore. My philosophy is, if you don't like your job, GET A NEW ONE!!

My husband stopped here for dinner after an A's game on a Saturday. We arrived about 6:15pm. When we walked in the resturant was appropriately busy for a Saturday evening at that time, about a 30 min wait. We proceeded to seat ourselves on the bar area which had 2-3 open tables that were dirty, but available.  Within moments of sitting a busser came over to our table. Apologized for the dirty table and promptly wiped it down and got us silverware. Unfortunately it took another 15 mins to get acknowledged by a server. Another few more mins for OUR server to come to our table (no apology for the wait) to give us menus and take a drink order. The food seemed to take a long time coming out. Our server was very slow to round back around for refills.  The food was good, one of the very few highlights of our visit. Lastly, the music was very, almost ridiculously loud for a resturant!

Food was bland and dry.  Table was never cleared of appetizer plates or salad bowls. Soda was only refilled once. Had to ask.  Over priced Denny's food.  Our server was "Hector" P.S. Took over 15 minutes to pay for the meal. The card was in the check holder waiting to go for 15 minutes...
Fast service.  Didn't wait for a table.   Why three stars? Food was cold.  We had burgers and fries. Fries were soggy and cold . Not coming back .

Can I put down no stars? This is incredible - the food is basically the half frozen/barely cooked stuff that is apparently marketed as being suitable for consumption. Even browned out drunk people would spit this stuff out. I was tolerant about the service for some off reason (although that should've been my first cue that what was to follow was not going to be any better) - took 10+ minutes to get a server to distribute menus and about a solid 35 minutes to get my appetizer sample.  If that was a plan to somehow coax me into buying alcohol in the lull, it sure didn't work because all I wanted was to satisfy my hunger. Imagine my dismay and disgust when I received half cooked items that appeared to be edible but were repulsive upon biting and chewing.  It's a mystery to me how they stay in business - hopefully something changes but I'm absolutely never going back.

Ordered steak with spare ribs.   Ordered medium on the steak. I was given a steak which was 1/3 rare, 1/3 medium rare, and 1/3 medium. I wish I just went to Black Amgus.  Just wasted my $30. The meat tasted old.

Food was ok....services was terrible! It took our waitress 15 minutes to bring a child's drink! Utensils were not given to us until we asked for them and again it them 10-15 to bring them. We are really disappointed the place was not busy at all,  and we were there for like 2 hours!

Today was my first time ever eating at TGI Fridays. And i have to say I was really disappointed. The table we were put at was filthy, the silverware wasn't clean, the bathrooms were dirty (no tp in a few of the stalls!) and the waiter was horrible... we asked him for refills and it took 15 minutes to get a refill and we saw him standing around talking to other employees but he made eye contact with my bf 3 times. I also got really sick after i left. I don't recommend this place to anyone due to their lack of customer service skills, and the cleanliness of the establishment. I wish i could put down 0 stars but i couldn't post a review with out choosing atleast 1.

Worst customer service ever. The host has the worst time of voice and attitude. A lot of tables were open and would not sit the 6 of us who all fit in one booth and we were ahead of everyone else. They would not sit us and made us wait while they sit everyone who came in 10 mins after us. And still did sit us down.

I don't normally give 1 star but in this case I was being generous. Worst server ever. 20 minutes just to get drinks and then he breaks the drinks as he is bringing them. 30 minutes to get kids drinks. Asked for a manager and one never came. The order was completely wrong, had to ask for it to be corrected and it was still wrong. Cucumbers when we asked for none, no cheese on salad when we asked for goat cheese, sides missing, salads came after the meal. While I was looking for a unique dining experience, this level of unique should best be avoided. Food was great, service, however, left a lot to be desired.

Came here for unlimited appetizers. Food was pretty good. We ordered the boneless wings, potato wedges, and mozzarella sticks. We ordered the $10 deal but didn't realize that you couldn't change your appetizers with the $10 deal and that there was a $12 deal on the back of that menu that allowed you to change your appetizers. (Our mistake). Our initial waiter just seemed extremely inpatient with us. He was the type of waiter that while you're ordering is kinda walking away and talking to you behind his back. Made us feel super rushed and angsty. it also always took us forever to flag him down. Which made us really annoyed. The last straw was when we asked him to change our $10 deal to the $12 deal. He was so apathetic to our mistake saying no no no, you cannot do that in an extremely condescending tone. So we'd had enough! We called the manager and luckily the manager was so kind and sympathetic to our mistake and changed our deal. He also frequently checked up on us. What a great guy :) made it worth coming here. Cheers to great management!

I went here with a friend and I ordered a plate (I forgot the name) that had shrimp, chicken, and mashed potato. It was mediocre. The shrimp was a bit dry on the inside.  This place is expensive in my opinion. Especially for the food you get, which I heard can sometimes be really good and sometimes not that great.  Again, my experience was mediocre. It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't worth the 18 dollars I paid for that one dish.

Had a blast at this location. All of the workers there were very inviting and full of enthusiasm. Great food and great service. Love the atmosphere of the newly remodeled interior. Great place to unwind and enjoy some great company and food. I'll defiantly be back for more Friday's!

Came here for lunch about a week or so ago and this place has TERRIBLE customer service. We waited at least 5 minutes at the front door before anyone even came to seat us. I saw an employee and we even made eye contact, and she just walked away, which is sad in the restaurant business. The food was subpar. Burger was greasy, appetizers were greasy. Almost everything was greasy! And our server was hardly anywhere to be found. She'd come around every 30 minutes or whatever to go put in another order for our appetizer (which was unlimited by the way).  This place is terrible with terrible customer service. Sorry T.G.I., don't expect me to come back. Don't send me free food coupons either. I've seen and tasted your food, and I do NOT want to have my stomach pumped after. Deuces.

Can you give less than one star? I've been sitting at the bar for almost 20 minutes. There are three people tending it. They've walked past me literally over a dozen times and not once have either of them say "what can I get you. I'm going to sit here another  5 minutes and walk out... Do I look horrible? Maybe I smell... I can emphatically say no to either... This crew really sucks...I wish I could get their names but they don't wear name tags... It's now 6:42 and this kid just asked me "can I get you anything?" Hmmmm. I sat down at 6:15 Also WiFi sucks, the waitress I stopped to ask about it says so...

Edgar made this visit today without him this place gets  -4 stars. Edgar was the only person who even acknowledged our existence. He sat us down and took the time to customize our experience.  Service other then him is in need of major overhaul.

The food is usually pretty good but the service sometimes leaves something to be desired. I encountered a hostess and a waiter to determine which my friend had asked for a bag for our leftovers 5 minutes prior. Both acted irritated to answer my simple question. I wasn't really offended until they both proceeded with other duties, neither offering me a bag. After a minute I just left. That put a bad taste in my mouth about T.G.I.F. Never ignore a customer. Never.

We were worried about service because of all the bad reviews. But our experience was great! We arrived at 6:45pm on a Friday and were seated within 10mins. Our server, Deseree (spelling?), promptly brought drinks, then hot appetizers. Our entrees were ready and waiting for us before we finished the apps. Deseree let us eat in peace and discretely placed new drinks on the table as needed. When done, she showed up with a to-go box and the bill. Very happy with service and food.

Normally the male Bartenders know what they're doing at this location and are tentative to the customers. For the rest, especially one Bartender  named Summer, should keep in mind that the job you're in is a Customer Service based job. If you don't want to deal with the public and want to have a chip on your shoulder and have the demeanor that you're doing the PAYING customer a favor by assisting them, well then reality check Summer! Maybe you should just apply for food stamps and worry about your fake eye contact lenses, tacky acrylic nails, take a seat and stay home! Employees like this ruin businesses! Useless waste of space!

Service sucks!!! I waited 45 minutes for my check! Our waitress didn't even check if we needed anything! Ridiculous! I called the manager who didn't even bothered to come to our table! I'm only giving this place 1 star cause it won't allow me to do ZERO

This place sucks ass!!! How is it even still open?? Waiters seem to be hiding from you whenever you need them. No one is walking around helping. Not sure if it's because we sat at the bar area, but the waiters don't come back to you until 50 minutes later. The people who bring out the items send the food to wrong tables... I put 1 star because I am being generous.

I was so excited to go here, but was disappointed. Their online menu (which we checked out before going) does not match up with what they have at the restaurant, so we didn't get to order what we had our hearts set on ordering in the first place. I was still stoked to order my chicken burger, which ended up tasting like the inside of an overused BBQ. Nothing impressive about either of our meals.  TGIFriday's is an overpriced Red Robin, except Red Robin is way better.

Awful food that's all. If u do do not care about ur grilled chicken to be dry and test like it was made a week go, if u do not care about ur bill be so much for nothing, and if u do not care about the waitress makes u wait almost 15 min for ur refill, then this is your place.

Excellent customer service! Great specials going on. Try their unlimited appetizers, $10 for unlimited of one choice or $12 for multiple unlimited appetizers. Great deal. Awesome staff. I read previous reviews I have always had an awesome experience here. Come on Down and give TGIFRIDAYS a chance, Great staff!!!!!

My friends Kristine and Alex decide to try out the "Endless Appetizer" promotion and wow it was so worth it! Our server, Sadia was fantastic! She got me a beer at happy hour price even though we were seated less than 5 minutes before it ended which I do appreciate. We then told her that we wanted to do endless apps so she came back with a special menu. I'm not quite sure why they don't just include it with the main menu, but once she brought it out, she explained how it works. There are 2 sides to this special menu. The $10 side lets you pick any one item and they will continue to only bring that item until you are full. But for $2 more, ($12) you flip the menu and you can choose between boneless wings, mozzarella sticks, potato skins, pot stickers, etc. and switch between any of them until you are full.  If you are dining in with friends, my suggestion is to pay $10 for the wings and all of the different flavors and then pay $12 to try out the other apps. As long as you order 1 extra refill, it's already worth it! Overall, the food was pretty good and the service was quite fast on Wednesday. Highlight of the night was Sadia! Such an amazing server who always has a smile on her face and is super helpful. I hope there are more people like her!
