I'm actually surprised at the ratings this location has, I will admit the hostess up front aren't the friendliest nor do I think they do a very good job of greeting but my experience wasn't all too bad.  My waiter was great, consistently checked up and made sure everything was to our liking. Mind you it was a crowded Friday night in the patio area. He made suggestions and assurance of our choices.  Ordered the sampler plate and for appetizers it was filling and big enough to share with everyone. The crab cakes were not up to standard though. Over seasoned and mushy. The bbq chicken was sweet and tangy just the way it was meant to be.  The blended margaritas were on hit and happy hour is always the best time.

So we get there and the place is packed. Hostess says at least 45minutes for a table of 7. Drunks walking out of the place and literally belching on there way out (barf). We get called in 15mins and as soon as you walk in place is dirty noisy and rowdy. I see the happy hour menu that is all day Sunday and understand why the crowd is how it is, ghetto in all its glory.  The waitress was nice but has no clue about the food or menu. Starters were good and got there quick. Nachos were small for a chain restaurant but were tasty, great boneless buffalo wings, potato skins and mozzarella sticks. The artichoke dip was also good but not enough chips which after asking they brought more. The new jack sampler is generous, the new jack sliders yummy, We asked about vegetarian options for my daughter and dumbly the waitress said we don't have anything vegetarian. I also asked her if the dish I was asking for had "caprese salad" because I couldn't make it out from the picture in the menu and she said no "its basil, tomatoes and mozzarella" once again  lol!!! The chips the show on the menu didn't come with the dip and the portion of my plate was smaller than what you saw on the menu. The rice and the steak with the langostino lobster was delicious just small. My kids enjoyed their burgers as well and my husband. Drink wise the margaritas were big and made correctly as well as the mai thai. All in all I gave it 3 stars because of the annoying crowd and un-informed waitress. Good place to drink and have appetizers if your on a budget and don't have kids with you (they were cussing left and right to us).

I visited TGIF's tonight on my weekly get together with some family and my initial feeling from looking at the other Yelp reviews was caveat emptor.  In the end I can't say I agree with them.  The food was very good, and our server, a young gal named Dez was a superb hostess and handled our party of 6 with ease.  I think I'll be coming back here again.

Endless appetizers for the win! I came with a group of 7 people on a Friday evening (TGIF!!!) around 6:45pm. Any later, we would have definitely had to wait for seats. This place fills up quickly! We asked for the endless app menu. For $10, you can pick one appetizer and refill that same one as many times as you want. For $12, you pick an appetizer, and then refill with appetizers of your choice. If you go in a big group like I did, you can do multiple $10 options and share with your friends. What a steal! -Mozzarella sticks: Crispy and cheesy -Spinach Florentine Flatbread: Tasty but very filling -Pan-Seared Potstickers: More like dumplings because they didn't pan fry them enough -Beef Tostadas: Tasty but the tostada was pretty hard -Boneless Wings: You can never go wrong with Garlic Parmesan and BBQ. However, Ghost Pepper was definitely my favorite - spicy but super flavorful. The PB&J totally tastes like Thai curry, which I surprisingly enjoyed. Every 15 minutes or so, we got rounds of the appetizers I just listed. I think we did about 6-7 rounds and we were stuffed! I had a wonderful time feasting and catching up with my boys from high school. Our server Greg was the best! He was very accommodating, and made sure all our requests were fulfilled.
I like hanging around night. TG Friday is one my choice. Unfortunately the kitchen is closed earlier than other place, but we always enjoy dessert! Pls try Oreo Madness $6.29.

we went during the summer and did the $10 all y9u eat appetizers. I am still in shock on how downhill the food went. UI used to LOVE TGI Fridays. That food tasted like the store bought freezer food. it was horrible. We didn't even do any refills. Very disappointed.

One of my friends and I were catching up and were celebrating my belated 30th with some drinks and apps. I had never been before last week, but had seen commercials about their amazing appetizers, so I thought what the heck.  The bar was bustling and busy. There were a few sports games going on. We sat in the bar surrounded by several televisions. Too bad I'm not a sports fan because it would have been a dream come true.  It was happy hour, so my friend and I got two margaritas. I got the Mango Berry blended and loved it. I do highly recommend that drink. Got me pretty buzzed as well. Pretty generous in alcohol.  For apps, we tried the mozzarella sticks, ahi tuna chip bites, and the sesame chicken tenders.  - the mozzarella sticks were fine. Nothing special.  - the ahi tuna was a mess. It wasn't seared properly, and ended up getting the chip soggy. The fish was grisly and you couldn't take a clean bite without struggling with the fish. Good flavor but technically a flop.  - the chicken was great. Good flavor and crispy on the outside. However, they were on the border of being burnt they were so dark.  I also ordered the clam chowder. Not pleased. It had a weird flavor and color. I could barely taste the clams either.  I would return for drinks a few of the apps (after carefully reading reviews next time), but I will most likely not order from the meal menu considering my friend did not like her pasta dish and I really disliked the clam chowder.

I went to TGIF for thanksgiving..we ordered jack daniel ribs full rack. When the server brought it, i was so dissapointed to see how small their ribs was . It looked like they are cutting back, because the ribs i got was just 60% of i usually get. I could see more bone than meat. The plate for it is also smaller, may be that is their strategy to make the ribs look big!...i used to love the ambiance of TGIF not until they remove all the decorations on the walls and now it looks just so plain and boring! The only good thing is , jack daniel ribs taste the same. The servers are not as pleasant as before too. Is it the change of ownership?  I will still give a try next time because their jack daniels is my all time fave.
Best customer service from Greg, Alexis and Tammy! My favorite waiters! One of my favorite places to go to and their happy hour is actually reasonable! A cool place to chill and drink with friends!
Very good service and nice food as I spent one dinner with my colleague. Traditional TGI menu available - we like drinks and foods. Good for hangout.
This place is awful. The steak I ordered was cold and so was the appetizers. Never going back again.

I mean maybe today was just a good day lol but Greg gave us the BEST SERVICE we have ever received in a restaurant (too dramatic? lol really tho). We basically didn't have to ask for anything because he took care of everything! It's like he was reading my mind or maybe I was just lit LOL he was great. Thanks for making a good day better! =)

Service has always been slow no matter what time I go - busy or not. They allowed me to have my dog join my dinner in the outside seating area - but then a week later dogs weren't allowed anymore and they tried to tell me because management changed - and when I said "in a week?!!" After my run I decided to come in for lunch, little skeptical on what to eat but since it's union landing you can find anything. So here I am at Friday's for a quick meal. First off I've been here many times before from watching the big game and birthday gatherings with friends. Surprisingly I had yet to write a review. Well here we go.        They gave a great two for $20 deal that I indulged in with the wifey. Keep in mind you get what you pay for so the portions are a bit smaller. We have a rewards deal that allowed us to get a complimentary chips and salsa with our meal. I went with the chicken parm with tomato and the Mrs tried the 6 once steak with sweet potato fries. I hate to write a bad review, but the service here is terrible.. I'm giving this place a 1 star for the service that is provided. It shouldn't take 10 minutes to order a drink at the bar when there's only 3 people sitting at the time. The server should really get off her phone and pay attention on what's going on around her. We were able to get a table in the bar pretty easily for a Friday night, which was about the only positive thing that happened. The service was INCREDIBLY slow, the food was pretty unimpressive for the price we were being charged, and the parking was a nightmare.

I can't possibly fathom why TGI's currently averages 2.5 stars on Yelp.  It's a restaurant chain that easily outclasses its other competitors within its league of similar price range and food type, you know...Applebees, Chili's, etc.  Based on that comparison, I'll be reviewing under that pretext. Allow me to tip the scale a bit. For your typical run of the mill, All-American, fast, sit-down restaurant, TGI's is splendid.  On numerous occasions, I enjoyed the New York steak, ribeye, full rack of pork ribs, shrimp, Bourbon Barrel Mahi Mahi, top sirloin steak, all coupled with potatoes, sweet potato fries (real good!), fresh vegetables, and spinach/garlic.  Veggies are cooked well (nothing special though), and steaks are actually served medium rare like I asked, every time.  And honestly, I think their Jack Daniel's Signature BBQ sauce delicious and goes with just about everything.   They even have calories listed on the menu for each meal for the calorie conscious, and frankly, I think the portions are just fine since I can finish it comfortably.  I can eat a ton more, but the typical American diet has average meals easily in the caloric surplus.  Of course, I'm not one to judge anyone's gluttony, but I'm digressing.  I guess one can argue the price point, but this goes back to other restaurants within the same league that are of similar price.  The difference?  The food quality of TGI's is easily in the upper band; it just tastes better.  Also, service has been attentive every time and the cocktail selection is numerous. What else is there to judge for a restaurant of this caliber?  Despite the welcoming name to come on Fridays, don't.  Especially on a Friday evening -- place is packed.

I have not been to a Fridays in years and years, and don't seem to remember it impressing me much way back then, so I was pleasantly surprised here! We were told to wait 5-10mins to be seated, so we thought ok thats not too bad. 15 mins go by and we looked at the seating area, and there were SO many open tables, pretty much everywhere it was empty except the bar area where they kept telling people they could sit. 8 men came in and they were directed to that area because of "lack of seating"....thats a large party, why would you want them crammed in the bar, where they might not order as much due to lack of table space? Loosing $$ for sure by doing this. One mom and daughter were ahead of us, they looked like they had been waiting a while and they finally got seated about 5 mins before us. We should have left after we saw them walk out about 5 mins later shaking their heads. After they left, they sat us at a dirty table (when there were TONS of clean tables already set next to us). The girl said your server will be here shortly...another almost 5 mins go by and no server so I press the "call server" button on the tablet at the table. We gave it another 5 mins and then my husband and I were so fed up we walked out too. We went to Chevy's near by and were immediately seated, given menus and food in the same amount of time that it took for us just to walk out of TGI Friday's. We have both worked in food service (for many many years) and this was just unacceptable. Its not like they were short staffed, there were 3 girls standing up front talking, and then occasionally a male server as well. Plus we saw about 6 other servers zipping about, but when you have 4 servers standing up front for 20 mins talking you have a management and staff problem. My recommendation to management (having management experience myself): Keep an eye on your FOH staff, they are not doing their jobs and you are loosing customers as a result. You lost my husband and I AND the mother and daughter before us. Plus the large group of men who went to the bar area instead of being seated right away at a large table - believe me it was empty enough to combine tables together.

Food was good, just felt like they should have put more on the plate for the price. I like the atmosphere when I came to eat here. One thing I would for sure get here again and that's it is the Beer and burgers that's mostly it if I wanna get my money's worth.

Great experience! It was a Tuesday so there was no waiting. We had a quick very polite waiter. The burger was the best I've eaten in a long time. Luis the manager introduced himself making sure we were enjoying ourselves. I will definitely return.

Truly disappointing.  Stopped by here the day after Christmas to find only a few customers, and 3 servers, none of whom could take the time to seat our party.  After waiting 10 minutes, another pair of customers arrived and were waved to a table.  No one showed any real concern for us, so we took our business elsewhere.

It's TGI Friday's in going to this restaurants for many years always have decent food it's not over-the-top but definitely a really good meal at a fair price this particular Friday's seems to have really decent food service is a little lax hence the three star rating Goodbar good steaks don't like the Jack Daniels sauce so much but everything else is really good for the appetizers to the ambience of the restaurant a good place to eat

Stop by today with friends start of with glass of beer and spicy wings, guess it was awesome. My friend had plate of pork and I choose to order ribs. Food came fast hot and fresh. Had great time and will come back in future. Love this place ohhh great customer service

I go here every holiday for an Irreverent Holy Day celebration with my friend, Queen David, and his Queen Mum. We love the steak and lobster while everyone else eats turkey. LOL. Food was great but the service was HORRIBLE!! We brought this up to the manager and he was no help at all, not even an apology! Will be taking my business to BJ's for now on!

Service was alright, they didn't give us any napkins and we had to wait a bit for them to finally hand us some. Burgers are delicious especially the chicken strips. Ask for less ice in your drinks. A little pricey.
Got our food to go and it was just gross and didnt look nice. Giving it 2 stars for location

Endless appetizers never sat empty, drinks always refilled, and overall a great experience. Parking lot is a mess, could use more space and enforcement of handicapped rules. If I could give TGIF zero stars I would. The only positive thing I have to say is the waiter was great very friendly and attentive. My husband and I ordered a steak and lobster. My son ordered a child's cheese burger. We asked for our steaks to be cooked medium well and when we got our steaks they were well done, the lobsters were salty and the baked potato was bland. My son said his burger tasted like his schools cafeteria lunch and my margarita tasted watered down more ice than any alcohol. Definitely not our money worth we will not be coming back.

Worst customer service!!!! It took forever to get our drinks and appetizers. Of course the server didn't know what all we ordered and messed up our bill. Non of the managers were helpful and didn't offer any discounts or complimentary item for incorrectly charging us. I think this location needs to hire qualified Managers who can actually speak English and understand customers!

I did not can not remember the name of the waitress that was supposed to be takimg care of us as she left a horrible impression as she visit our table twice during the hour that we were there. Visited over a month ago 2/4/17 charges posted 2/6/17. As of today I noticed I was charged again 3/8/17 for the same meal. The manager explained they had an issue with VISA in February and suggested I call the bank. How Annoying!
Under staffed on a sat. night. Rude . Servers  just stroking it while everyone waits . Obviously  don't care about business. My last time here !

Visited here with my sister a few nights ago and sat at the bar which was open seating. Our server greeted us about 5 or 10 minutes after we checked the menu. We both ordered bar drinks, a Peach sangria (recommend if you like something fruity but not too sweet) and a Moscow mule. I also ordered the bourbon barrel chicken which was very delectable! Came with 2 scoops of mashed potatoes and a bed of broccoli. Had a pleasant experience compared to the last time I visited TGIF which was about 3 years ago. Service was a bit slow but the waiters dropped by a few times to check on us so I was thankful for that. I would recommend coming here early for happy hour before 6pm :)

Was starving and the wait for a party of four at Texas Roadhouse was nearly two hours, so we casually settled for TGIF since it was basically next door and er...big mistake. Having the frozen Mozarella sticks for years from Target or Costco, I have never once stepped foot in a TGI.  Our recent trip to TGI was both interest and gift card based- I mean, a meal on someone else- why not? :) We came on Thursday and there was a bit of a busy lobby. The hostess told us it would be a 25 minute wait, and took our contact information to text us when our table was ready. The ease of contact was so convenient and made it easy for us to wait in the car without having an obnoxious vibrating buzzer interrupting. Or, the germs those carry! At about 21 minutes through, we received a text message and were ready to eat! Our waitress was beautiful and fun, her name was Marjorie and she was very attentive and friendly. Within 2 minutes of ordering drinks, she brought it our way, and was very quick on her feet.  For our appetizer we ordered the mozarella sticks which were sold out! My dream of fresh ones was foiled, but next time I will plan to come at an earlier time in the day. In substitution we ordered potato skins and requested the bacon to be excluded from the recipe. Marjorie put in our order and ten minutes after, we're munching on our potato skins telling her things were great between a mouthful of cheese!  The potato skins were very good, I preferred them with ketchup to the sour cream, but they were the only dish lacking presentation. The cheese used is a kraft or packaged sliced cheese, making it look a bit 'at home' like, but nonetheless, very tasty! Next time, we will order mozarella sticks though, the potatoes weren't much to write home about. Our main entree was burger themed! According to Yelp reviews here, there was no consistency with what to order , so we gambled on burgers.  My boyfriend ordered the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger, and I ordered the Black Bean Chipotle Burger! I totally appreciated that being a quality vegetarian option, since the pasta dishes were covered in chicken or meat, making it a bit difficult to find some good options with protein. Not even fifteen minutes after our appetizer, we receive our entrees - which was surprisingly fast! The staff really makes sure the customers are fed and not irritable, which was completely appreciated.  My boyfriend's seal of approval was cleaning his plate and nodding with a smile! I couldn't believe it! My burger was very well made. The bun used is a sweet roll similar to Hawaiian bread, with a mild chipotle mayo sauce combination, lettuce, avocado, tomato, onion, on the black bean burger. The combination was both flavorful, and satisfying, taking into account that many vegetarian options are blander or very unseasoned. :) I was pleasantly surprised! For anyone looking to order this meal, it tastes like black beans and a soft bean veggie mix- so if you're looking for a meat alternative TASTING like meat, this wouldn't be a good substitute but it's just as tasty! For dessert we ordered the fudge brownie with vanilla bean icecream! I imagined a more structured foundation of brownie, but it was more pudding/molten lava fudge mixed with brownie pieces so it's very very soft. Less cakey! The vanilla icecream was mildly sweet staying true to vanilla flavor, not overwhelmingly sweet like artificial icecream. What's great is all desserts are similarly priced so there's no loss in money or choices. Overall we give TGI four stars for amazing service, and food. We both agreed upon leaving we would definitely return, which was a big plus! Marjorie is super sweet and friendly, she's like a total gal pal that has the hookup with great food!

My Appetizer is normally $10.00 and I paid $5.00 so you are going to give me my appetizer for free saving $5.00 Wow how generous! The bill was $52.00 and my wife even tipped the waitress. I said how about cut the bill in half and we will call it even. He said I can't do that.  I called the 1-800 number and spoke to someone and they offered a $10.00 gift card for the bad service. I said you are offering us a $10.00 gift card for lousy service that took 3 hours to be seated and be waited on are you serious? I said there was several people coming in after us and being waited on before us. They even got their food before we did. Here is what should have happen that night. 1) 15 mins to be seated (not 30 mins) 2) Host should walk the guest to a clean table (NOT DIRTY) and hand both of us menus. Then in less than 5 to 10 mins  3) Waitress/Waiter should then ask the normal everyday question "Can i start you off with something to drink"    4) Waitress/Waiter should then come back in 2 to 5 mins to take our order 5) Appetizers should be on the table before the main meal 6) The meal comes 10 to 15 mins later after the appetizer 7)  Waitress/Waiter normally asked if you need any refills or how is the food, is everything okay? 8)  Waitress/Waiter usually ask if you need a to go box if you have food left over. 9)  Waitress/Waiter then bring you the check/bill for check out 10) Guest usually leaves a small tip if the service was good Going to a restaurant should not take no more than 1 hour to be seated waited on and eat food. (depending if it's really really crowded)  Not 3 hours! 6 pm to 8:45pm ? Hometown Buffet is 100x better than this TGI Fridays!

Horrible experience. We waited 30 minutes beyond the time they told us the wait would be. The food took forever to arrive and when it did our burger and fries were cold and broccoli lukewarm. I ordered the bourbon barrel chicken and it was the smallest piece of chicken I have ever been served from a dinner menu (and we eat out A LOT.)  Halfway through our meal we realized our son's glass was cracked 3/4 around the glass and he had already drank a third of it. QUALITY CONTROL IS LACKING. We appreciate that the manager credited one of our meals because of the cracked glass, but an appearance at the table to apologize or ask how our meals were would have been nice. Leaving a restaurant hungry after spending a boat load of money is not good!
Very good food nice people working there make you feel welcomed great service makes me want to come back every time

Haven't been here for years... sat at the bar, since we didn't want to wait to sit down... plus we just wanted to drink beer and get appetizer's... the employees kept check up on us every 10min which is a good thing... but the restrooms of course was gross as usual. Nothing new with dirty restrooms there...

Excellent 5 star service from our friendly, accommodating waiter Kevin! Extremely patient and gave helpful suggestions as well. Mom's coupon was about to expire so we drove on over to the neighborhood Friday's for an early dinner at 5pm Saturday night. Staff welcome was on point! All of the wait staff had easygoing smiles and two of them were stationed at each door up front to cheerfully greet everyone entering. Now that's how to engage with customers. No wait to get seated but hosts did have a bit of a mix up on where to seat us since it wasn't busy yet. Tables and drink/dessert menus could have been wiped down a bit more, but not a big deal. The fam got steak & lobster tail and steak & salmon plates while I got a Caesar salad with 4oz steak. Lobster is either steamed or grilled. Kevin suggested grilled for more flavor, but it sticks to the shell. Still good though! Jasmine rice pilaf is tasty and has the right texture here! Great accompaniment to meat or fish for the rice fanatics. My only issue is not receiving my Caesar dressing on the side, despite the confirmation. I didn't bother saying anything cuz I didn't want to waste food. Soft pretzels with cheese & bacon dip are always good here! Perfect size for 4. Shrimp cocktail tasted like the typical frozen kind. Drinks all around! I swear, after my sis turned 21 I'm pretty sure we're becoming an alcoholic fam haha! JK. Tried the Mandrin Mule-- tasted like soda with a hint of orange! I really liked this. Sis got a sweet Mixed Berry Mojito, good as well. Mom got a Prosecco bottle and Dad a glass of red wine. Might try the blended Frose next time. The Zoosk pay machine had a broken receipt slot issue but we still paid using it after redeeming our coupon personally. All in all, great place to have drinks and a comforting meal. Happy hour sounds like a good deal to unwind any day of the week! They're open until 1am weekdays and 2am weekends. Sunday has HH prices all day, and also stretches to the dining room, unlike the other days where it's just at the bar area.

TGIF is a nice restaurant located in Union city landing next to 880 freeway. We went there for a quick drink and snacks prior to our movie in the nearby Century 25 Theaters. They had a few selection of beers on tap - mostly IPA's. We ordered beers, Chicken nachos, chicken strips and onion rings with fries. Service was average and we had to wait some time before the server came by to take our order. Overall a nice restaurant but just about average.

Tonight. Sunday night. Looking for some food. Head to T.G.I. Friday's. Friday's on a Sunday? Weird. I know. Walk inside. Nice and slow. Good sign. Unfortunately, the last good sign of the night. Hostess gave us no smile and barely a greeting. Not sure what her deal was. Maybe a bad night. Maybe something else. Or maybe, simply, rude. Get seated. Booth seats. Normally you'd find this to be of some comfort. Not tonight. It was as cold and unwelcoming as a baby on an airplane. We couldn't even stay to eat. We waited. Tried to flag someone down. Then waited some more. Nothing. Patience wore thin. As thin as a wet tissue.  Bye T.G.I. Friday's. I'll see next Friday, but not you.

I was heading home, super hungry and decided to do the 7mile drive to come eat here, sat myself, and now it's been 28minutes and no one came up to my table, nobody, there are at least 8 servers working , on my side at least 4 and none of them had the idea to ask me if i want anything, the table I sat on had a tablet, pressed the button to call for service a red light on top of the tablet blinked for 10 minutes, again nothing. People walked by , looked at me, at my super dirty table, yes, no one came to clean the table from the last customer's... this is the worst service I ever seen at a restaurant, and I've been to a lot of them... Just ask a server if I could order, she said, let me get someone for you... hahaha  I'm super hungry and I think I won't be able to get any food here!!! Worst experience at a T.G.I. Friday's!!!

Wow...what terrible service. Oh wait, you would have to even be seen by a waiter to say that. Waited for 10 minutes at our table for service and no one even came to our table. From the number of workers that were chatting with each other I would gather that it was a slow Sunday night.  Note to management: Employees need to have more customer awareness and have more friendly attitudes.

I am literally sitting in this Friday's bar area as I write the review. I am sooooo utterly disgusted at this location and the food they tried to pass as edible. I am giving them 2 stars only because of the waiter without him this place would've gotten 1 only because zero isn't an option. Let's start with the appetizers, we ordered onion rings and mozzarella sticks. The onion rings were hard as rocks and way over cooked, the mozzarella sticks were cold (like how the hell do you serve cold mozzarella sticks). So I said I wasn't gonna complain but when they placed my sizzling chicken and shrimp on the table I was too done. I damn near exploded. I order this meal every single time I go to Friday's and it was not what I ordered. Why is my shrimp covered in some type of red sauce, why do my mashed potatoes look like f***ing soup and why is the cheese so damned watery? I am beyond disappointed. Friday's you habe lost a customer..

I regret going in here and spending my money. The quality doesn't meet its price. I ordered the southern style chicken burger because it looked good in the picture. When it came it was soggy. On top of that when I was picking my side, our server, JULIAN, recommended rice with my meal. I was astonished the fact that he would offer knowing that my order was a burger. I wanted to ask him if he ever tried rice on the side when he eats a burger. It sparked in my mind that the reason why he offered it was because I am Asian. I decided to go for lemon butter broccoli. I was surprised that when it came, it was still inside a plastic bag that recently was just microwaved. I totally lost my appetite. It was disgusting. To save anyone who are trying to eat here, DON'T EVER GO ON THIS LOCATION.
I miss this place. Nothing like underage drinking, smoking pot in your car outside, and snorting coke in the bathroom. Simpler times those were.
Haven't been awhile and ordered their 12.99 bbq ribs. Will definitely be ordering the ribs again.

Service was ridiculous, we were sat by the host with the long braids & glasses. Sat at the first booth to the left, we were left un-greeted for 25 minutes, my friend & myself are both in the restraint industry, & at our job we are supposed to greet our tables within the first 30 seconds, there were about 4-5 servers in the little side station by the booth who kept looking over at us & how we were not attended. This is literally so ridiculous, I then got up and went to the host and asked if there were a server in my section, and she replied "oh yeah we're trying to figure that out right now" and I replied "why were we sat in a section where there was no server" and she came over to our table and said "I'll just move you guys over to another table so you can have a server" my friend then said "why haven't we been greeted" and the host replied with "sorry there's nothing I can do" I'm a very rude tone, we were then sat in the first booth in the bar and were still NOT greeted for about 7 minutes, and the manager came over, very inconsiderate to what was going on, did not apologize for anything and then asked "would you like me to go get you a server?" I mean of course, I can't serve myself. I am in a management position and I know that the guest is not always right, but we they are. She said It was very hard to deal with us because we had "an attitude" ofcourse we had an attitude, who wouldn't after not being greeted almost half an hour? We sat down a 4:53 & we just left at 5:30. STILL not greeted nothing. This place always has the worst service. The manager was hella rude & your host need to be retrained. Wish I could give this 0 stars.

This is my first Yelp review ever. Had the worst experience. Food was late and overcooked. I wanted to complain but I had no time to get a new steak because it was late. The server was rude to me when I complained. She made it sound like it was my fault. She claimed to have many to customers, but she was busy talking to her friends. I've never felt so unimportant in my life. I will never go back there, ever.

I have been here a couple of times and they have all been pleasant. I usually order the southern fried chicken sandwich or the chicken tenders but have also tried the black bean cheesecake. Everything I tried were pretty good so I don't really try anything else even though I should. The service has been nice all the times that I have been. Will have to go back to try some more items.

Place is a joke. We got seated at one of the tables next to the bar. The waitress came over and took our order. Two Jameson's and two appetizers. She disappears for 15 minutes. No signs of our drinks. We get ready to leave. The waitress walks up to us and asks to see some IDs? Uh isn't it waitressing 101 to ID prior to putting in the drink order to the bartender? So I asked if our drinks were even made up. She said they weren't. I tell her she's too slow and to just forget about it. While my buddy and I are walking away she yells to me "look we have your drinks"  some other waiter was bringing them with our appetizers. At that point it was too late, we kept walking. Hopefully the waitress learned her lesson. YOU ID PRIOR TO PLACING THE ORDER WITH THE BARTENDER TO AVOID CONFUSION.

Poor management; has not trained some of the waiters. Came on a Sunday night, not that busy. Our waiter never came back after some of our requests.  Not sure if she was not as attentive since it was close to the end of her shift.  We had our 'call server' light on and she never came by to check on us.

This is the 2nd time that we visited this TGIF's and we had the same exact experience upon entrance. Weeks back, my boyfriend and I walked in and the first time around we got a group of employees chit chatting, not greeting us, and all made eye contact with us and proceeded to walk away. Then this second time around on Friday around 7 or so on November 24th, 2017, we got one female, whom also did not greet us, instead made eye contact with us for a couple seconds without saying a single word, until I said Hello?! and still got nothing, so I said "just two" and even then she walked away to check which table was available and then came back and told us to follow her with the most least enthusiasm and just gave us the menu, no silverware. Then our waiter literally told us that he SAW our appetizer sitting there ready to be taken to us but walked away and came back and it was gone?! So therefore we got our appetizer until way after our meal, not to mention we had to wait for our silverware then we had asked for extra ranch and jack daniels sauce which also took long. Seriously unfortunate that we love the food but the service is just so terrible. Looking through the yelp reviews, clearly management is not taking action.  Sucks to go to a restaurant but have these mishaps happen because it truly ruins the experience.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. The first messed up on a burger that we ordered and took the complete order back without offering any fries or anything. The second time around, the messed up the burger again and blamed it on a party of 10 being there, which we didn't even see. We also had 2 sizzling chicken and shrimps and let me tell you, it WAS NOT sizzling at all. They served our dishes with sliced pieces of the sandwhich American cheese on top of our vegetables. Seriously? It was so cold and it didn't even melt which it should have if it was "sizzling". The waiter was this chick who was a complete bimbo and did nothing to compensate for the inconvenience. She was so monotoned and sounded like she didn't even care that they messed up on our order twice and served us cold food. No wonder TGIF Fridays is closing down in a lot of areas!

Went there for lunch on Friday. Good friendly service and a nice polite lady and was seated right away by hostess.  I'd say this chain and Applebee's are one and two. I've always liked the food served here and today I had a good burger and it tasted nice and fresh. Had French onion soup that was a tad disappointing but it's my go to when I go out to eat. I'll be back but not ordering that soup anymore.

Because I live in Union City, this spot is an easy go-to especially for late night eats and dranks. I usually just go to the bar area (seat yourself) so my review is generally about my multiple experience from here. Here's what keeps me coming back: Happy Hour 3pm-7pm and 10pm-close and all day on Sundays. Half price apps and pretty good drink deals too. The service is pretty awesome, the staff and friendly and attentive.

Wow! What can I say? I used to come here a lot. I always enjoyed their Jack Daniels Flat Iron. Tonight I came here and hear they no longer carry the flat iron. Then I went to order a house salad and found out they no longer carry Thousand Island Dressing. When I received my JD Rib-eye, it was tasty and cooked to my satisfaction. The broccoli was brown and old and not appetizing at all. Such a shame as I won't be coming back any time soon.

Me and my husbands always comes here and overall the experience is usually good but today experience was horrible. First it took almost an hour to get our food and my husband was eating coleslaw when he noticed the bowl had some dried brown substance inside. We asked for the manager and his comment was it looks like beer cheese. Omg we ordered coleslaw so that means they serve us coleslaw in a dirty container.
I am in LOVE with this restaurant and the service is amazing. We got a seat where we wanted it and every time our server saw that my glass was empty she filled it back up with my red wine.

My daughter wanted some potato skins on Christmas Eve. I called in my phone order and 15 minutes later I wanted to add to my order, but she told me it was last call due to closing early, which I completely understood. I got there and waited about 10 minutes, no big deal it was Christmas Eve and the employees wanted to get home to their families too. Lala was so sweet, she kept telling me just a few more minutes and checked on me. When I got my order she said it's on the house Merry Christmas! So sweet and wasn't expecting it, and the potato skins were yummy. A+ service and 5 stars for lala and her excellent customer service

Like how long does it take to get a beer?! The server was great...when he actually came to the table! Waited forever for some mozzarella sticks! Took damn near half an hour! Service was garbage, never coming back!!!!

I used to like coming here because it's local and easily accessible for all of my friends to meet at. However, the food portions are smaller and more expensive. We only come here as a last minute option for drinks. One good thing that hasn't changed is the kind staff which helps.

This place is a joke.  I had to come here for a birthday dinner and it was a horrible experience.  After waiting 45 to get seated, we waited 15 minutes just for the waitress to take our order. Then 20 minutes just to get the drinks (sodas).  The food took another 45 minutes to get here.  Altogether almost 1.5 hours to get the food

Soooo glad I came here for dinner! They have 'Beyond Meat Burgers' People! I had to show my server what I was talking about on my phone and he went to go check because it's not on the menu YET but it was beyond good! It truly tasted like a beef burger, (probably same grill didn't think to ask) but without the grease and at times grislely fat as you eat it. Also got the Pretzel sticks with dipping sauce. Man oh Man they were huge! I could have just eaten that for dinner if they didn't have the burger that I made the trip out for. Very nice server and for a Friday night only a 10 minute wait to be seated. All n' all will be back again soon!

Totally disappointed.  You don't come to TGIFridays expecting a great meal but when the wings are dry, the potstickers are burnt, and the server is too preoccupied with chapping with coworkers.  This lunch is time out of my life that I'll never get back. Beyond disappointed.
